M5UKc2VufR15wG9OyDtldw.text: Cannot say enough good things about this place. The service is wonderful and the food is great. Feels personal when you're in there. Prices are fair, great place to be for a Sunday brunch.

PjquW4VGXDoHL2AqcboEdw.text: I went to Pikes with a group of friends for Sunday brunch which was a buffet. Having worked in restaurants before I tend to pay attention to the cleanliness of a restaurant and especially on a buffet I'm cautious about how safe the food appears to be to eat.    There were items I stayed away from because I didn't feel they were safe. For example, the cold salads that were sitting on top of an ice well. They should have been sunk into the ice to cover most of the container.   I touched the outside of one of the containers and it was room temperature.  No thanks I'll pass.   And then there was the sneeze guard over the lunch items (sort of off to the side) it looked like a relic from the 1920s complete with a plexiglass cover that you could barely see through it was so scratched and smudged.   I couldn't bring myself to eat anything from underneath that relic of the past.   But the worst thing was the uncovered pan of (I hope!) discarded meat from the roast beef sitting on the floor behind the buffet.  Disgusting!  No wonder I had to shoo flys away from our table.     The items that I did have were:  Bacon -- it was bits and pieces of bacon not strips.  Very greasy.    Biscuit and gravy - biscuit was good.  Gravy was blah  Hash brown casserole - good.  Best thing I had.   Eggs Benedict - OK "A" for effort here but honestly don't serve Eggs Benedict on a buffet.  Just don't.   Chocolate cake -  I take it back THIS was the best thing I had.    To be fair my friends said they enjoyed the food and thought it was a pretty good buffet.

KeQTdPGGdW6JJ0ZT3ccDsg.text: I had no clue shallow hal was taped here. The shrimp and grits were awaome and the shake was go die for. Bringing the kiddos next time!

SL9QfhsBIG2J-euUT0cwNw.text: I took guests here for brunch one Sunday and we were very underwhelmed. The food at the buffet was unappetizing and didn't taste any better than some type of institutional offerings. I found the place a bit sub par on cleanliness and despite the above - it was pricey. I won't return.

sreeselAAZBOmIAr0sXqgQ.text: First I ordered a whole wheat bun with my burger and got a white bun. They brought the whole wheat one out which was fine. About halfway through eating my burger I opened it up to take some onions off and I found a short black hair on my tomato. My waitress took it to the manager and he came to the table acting as if I was the one who put the hair on the sandwich. Then proceeded to ask if he could get me anything else without fixing the issue.

yBYjnZcq6FJ8O_KNBOYUgQ.text: I've been here twice, and already I have decided that I absolutely LOVE this place.  Because it's a soda shop, the decor is old-fashioned and reminiscent of my childhood days when the last of the soda shops and pharmacies were fading away.  The music played was mostly 50s and early 60s.  They even have a soda (and booze) bar at the front of the restaurant, where you can order a variety of soda and ice cream drinks.  My first trip was on Sunday for brunch.  For $13.95 (which may seem like a lot, until you try the quality of food on the buffet), you get access to a buffet with all kinds of goodies.  In addition to the traditional eggs and breakfast meat, you can choose muffins or pastries, a hashbrown casserole, eggs benedict, some french toast casserole thing, and fresh fruit.  After 10 AM, they also feature lunch dishes, including roast beef, soup, salad dishes, and pasta.  Finally, they offer a range of desserts to go with all of that, in case you haven't eaten enough pastries or other sweet things on the buffet.    You don't like buffets?  No problem for brunch!  You also have the option of ordering omelets, quiche, and pancakes as well, not to mention lunch items.  My second trip I went  for dinner.  I ordered the salmon caesar salad and fried pickles, and my friend got their pot roast dinner.  Both were quite delicious - the salad was filling without being too big.  The fried pickles were so good - cut somewhat thick with a tasty Southern batter.  I decided to order the Tollhouse Pie for dessert - it was so good, I'm convinced I could have eaten a whole pie in one sitting!  She had the carrot cake, which was delicious with a lighter cream cheese icing.  And the best part is that most of the dinners are $10-$15, which is quite reasonable.  Both times, we had awesomely friendly servers, both of whom were quite attentive.  My only gripe about this place is the parking situation.  Unfortunately, they do not have a parking lot that I could find; it's all street parking.  While there is a decent amount of parking, you have to fight traffic in the evenings to get to the parking, and I'm sure it becomes very difficult to find the busier they get.  Still, it's right off the light rail, so it would be super easy to park somewhere else and just take the light rail there.  I can see this being one of my regular places to eat.

4D8rI3iiaOyPiRSQJCwrUg.text: I loved the decor of this place as soon as I stepped through the door. On a cold Wednesday there was a lunch wait of about 10 min for a group of 4. In no time we were called to a booth, and looking around the decor was so interesting. All sorts of Pepsi memorabilia and old Pharmacy equipment.   On Wednesdays the soup of the day is tomato, which I paired with the 3 cheese grilled cheese. It was awesome. The waiter was awesome. The only thing that wasn't awesome was the parking, I had to parallel park. I am from Charlotte I cannot parallel park. Easy solution, ride the light rail. It's right there.

muksMTGIOlCyh0gzFyBS5g.text: It's been a number of years since I had the weekend brunch and I can attest that it was so much better than I remembered.  We had family in town this weekend - you know,  one of those situations when the kids outnumbered the adults.  We wanted a place that was accommodating for a party of around 20 with affordable options that could suit varying tastes.  Pike's checked all the boxes beginning with their ability to seat us in their private dining room with very little notice (called about an hour in advance).  Having tiered buffet pricing for adults and kids was a huge bonus and very family friendly weekend brunch option.  I almost forgot to mention the food - it was simply delicious with all the brunch staples and a few bonus surprises - sweet potato casserole, their fruit salad and the small pieces of cake were big hits.  I rarely post online but I was so impressed with our excellent experience that I had to recommend Pike's as an awesome option for families, big kids and little kids alike.

YrS4z_daeMpc4b4M43DUOg.text: Today was our first visit. Staff is the best. We ate outdoors and attention to us was incredible. Food was incredible too.  Hubby had pot roast. He was very pleased. I had "Panther" burger. Amazing favors. Next time I'll have small salad so I can have chocolate cake. We both had root beer floats. Great memories of times past. Easy to get to as the blue line stops just across the street. We will be back soon. Thanks for a great meal and a great experience.

Z6n8erEcw6atNs-KegT2EQ.text: Cute little place with some on street parking. Food was not amazing. I went with the grilled cheese because I think a place like this should have delicious standards and it's advertised as "the best in Charlotte".  Dry and Luke warm, at least the cheese was somewhat melted but sheesh, I make better grilled cheese at home.  Fries were typical frozen bag type. The table ketchup had about 2 tablespoons left in it. As a past service person, that makes me crazy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cute interior, have high hopes..

OvDNqAFLjmmRg1O1Rh5TxA.text: Ordered the pecan fried chicken and it was VERY good, kids ordered cheeseburger and fries, they were happy. My husband got the HUGE slice of chocolate cake and it's nice because it's not too sweet. The customer service is amazing, great service. We'll be back to try the brunch.

HMNLHkeoxLnjUBojLYpwCA.text: Talk about great service and a very cool atmosphere... Pike's has it.  I felt like I was jumping back in time and having lunch at the type of place my grandfather would bring me.  The menu had more to offer than I was expecting so don't worry about a limited selection.  The food was fresh and as mentioned before delivered with great service.  I would stop by again when in the area to try some of the "treats" I wasn't able to get to.

KzrqT_Yzsf4_r5vJ3X3VUw.text: Good diner-type food. Friendly service. Really good milkshakes. Nice family atmosphere. Cute decor.   I would definitely recommend this, especially as a casual dinner spot for families.

kwHx0bldS3awXkTjqQDI7A.text: Great atmosphere. Friendly service. 80's music, only thing I found strange is it closes at 10pm on Saturday.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great time with a great woman

3IHOrL0OG3F7BUzqanbnhQ.text: Stopped in today for a milkshake on a recommendation of a co-worker.  I opted for the peanut butter milkshake.. since I really like peanut butter and had a hankering for it, but besides that.. It is National Peanut Butter Month, so great choice any way that I looked at it.  The milk shake was good, just wished there was more of it for the price (it came to $5.28 with tax).  I sat at the soda counter which was cool and my server was Kyle who was nice enough.  I signed up for their rewards program, got points for my milkshake purchase and also earned a first-timer award good for a free dessert or appetizer on my next visit!! SCORE!!  On my next trip, hopefully I'll have more time to enjoy some of their food and of course enjoy my free app or dessert!

uJif4pSPnFqB3LVF8vgc4A.text: A friend I was visiting in Charlotte said we had to go by Pike's for the Sunday brunch while I was down. After I arrived, that's where we headed! As I understand, it is in the South End part of the city. I was glad he made the suggestion, as I and my friends had a great brunch experience.  The facade is a nice brick one, looking like another trendy place to go for eats or to hang out in the city, liked how it looked going in. Once inside, you are treated to a interior much more on the old fashioned side as the name suggests. Great look as an old time soda shop combined with a nice dining area on both sides. Very welcoming in design and look. I liked the atmosphere it gave.  As I said, we went for Sunday brunch, which is a buffet there. Man, it was some good stuff. Healthier fare such as fruit, cereals, or light breads, even to scones and a very light coffee cake. For more hardcore eaters, carnivores, and breakfast traditionalists (that would be me), there are eggs, bacon, sausage, hashbrowns, french toast, biscuits and gravy, grits, etc. There is also a side station for other main meals faves such as a wonderful beef carved as you come up to ask for it. Most everything I had was great, definitely a three plate brunch for me. The grits were a bit thin and my buds were not wild about the green beans but all in all, it was a great selection and meal.  I recommend going by Pike's for the Sunday Brunch buffet...good price (below 15 bucks as I remember) , great food, and nice staff. I will go back!

OFJ-5WwWfV3VtABe7Q3BFQ.text: My party was contacted & offered 1/2 price brunch after our previous visit (or lack there of). We returned today & were able to enjoy a great brunch. With that said, there was still some trouble finding our reservation the night before when a member of our party called to confirm. 1st she was told there was no reservation & then the person checked the "other" book & found the reservation.  Maybe streamlining to 1 book would help alleviate this issue?... Again, the food was really good.

sO0PKs6-pf6xg9fkTaq-VA.text: I was in here with a large group to celebrate a friend's birthday.  I was surprised how dead it was in the restaurant when I got there on a Friday night.    The food is wonderful - homestyle cooking...a good test for me at places like this is the meatloaf and this is one of the best meatloafs I've tasted in Charlotte.  Very flavorful with just the right of spice and a generous portion of gravy covered my loaf and mashed potatoes.  The mashed potatoes were some of the best also to compliment my meatloaf.  The disappointment came from the green beans.  They looked unappetizing like they were cooked too long or came directly from a can with that grayish green color.  They tasted like they looked so they lost the 5th star for this.  Server was good.  The restaurant was clean and everyone was friendly.    I ate too much so I didn't save room for ice cream but that gives me reason to come back.

HY_nJKkDmCsSnnGtcs1klQ.text: The shrimp and grits recently on special were the best I've ever had. My friend eating lunch with me ordered the same thing and agreed. The honey glazed biscuit was also delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. The shrimp and grits with honey glazed biscuit were divine!

YmhEYXHgWZN56naWlurfLA.text: Interesting place  We came here on a recommendation of a friend.  It was a neat inside, that they have that old-fashion feel of a soda pop store.  Place:  As mentioned it had a nice warm, cozy, soda-shop feel to the place.  Granted this was the same place that the Shallow Hal movie was featured in also.   Service: Good.  the manager is nice and made sure that we are happy with the food and our experience.  Only small downfall was that someone forgot my husband's order, so he had to wait a while for his order.  Price: It was not so bad. Price is reasonable with that they were offering.    What you have to try: Their shakes. Thankfully, we ordered one, and it was enough for two.

LSF4CSdpFmW7LQjD5FAR4w.text: I love how unique this place is. I went here for my girlfriends birthday. Food was super fast and delicious. Paul our server took great care of us. We will be back.

A15z-CvmT0N3ow7xmXyvtw.text: Came here after dinner on a Friday night around 9 pm. No wait, walked right in. We just had dessert. I loved the toll house pie, which is essentially toll house cookie dough on a pie crust with a scoop of ice cream. Good for 2 or someone who loves dessert! Someone else ordered the brownie sundae which was HUGE and definitely needed to be shared by more than 2 people.   Nothing about the place blew me away, but a solid stop for after dinner sweets!   For easy access take the light rail to east/west and walk south!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Toll house pie

JLgvrE2ft37AQ3NZNqEDMw.text: Walked here for some dessert and this place is amazing for those times when you just need a good 'ol fashion hot fudge sundae. The brownies and dense, warm and very fudgey. The vanilla ice cream is that yellowish french kind, not that chalky white junk. Tons of chocolate sauce, and whipped cream too. Share one with your friends or family, or don't. No need to share when it's that delicious.  Heads up, this place fills up on weekends.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot. Fudge. Sundae.

fwD-o55xYlBYrKKEGoB-ng.text: I'm not a picky eater. I usually don't leave reviews, but this is my second time eating here and both have been huge disappointments.   Ordered: chicken tenders/fries and green beans + thin mint milkshake.   Tenders and fries were both pretty soggy. The breading on a chicken tender should be crispy. They're honestly the quality I'd expect out of a freezer, even fast food places have better texture.   There's literally no seasoning in the breading of the tender or seasoning on the fries. So they're soggy and lack taste.   This would all be ok for me if I could dip them in sauce. I got one, half-filled cup of honey mustard. I got through about 2 tenders (out of 6) before I was out of dipping sauce. Didn't even get to dip the fries. Why sell a tender/fry combo and provide only one measly filled dipping cup?   Green beans were ok. Milkshake was good. Only good the milkshakes here, the food isn't very good.

Vu07nlgwQfOxV5UlW5X-lQ.text: YUUUUUM!!!! Came here with a co-worker for lunch. They had a good crowd but we were able to get seated immediately. Great atmosphere, lots of vintage items throughout the restaurant. There's a nice little patio out front for outside seating and plenty of indoor seating.   Our server was very attentive and pleasant. Food came out fast for as busy as they were. I had a build your burger on a salad bowl...the burger was delicious! Super flavorful, good portion sizes and I appreciated the option for fruit on the side instead of fries. This place has malts, homemade milkshakes, desserts, etc. There was a chocolate cake in the dessert case that had cake slices the size of your head...it was crazy! We each decided to indulge in a milkshake for the road. The chocolate was delicious, since they use their homemade chocolate ice cream for it there wasn't the overly sweet syrup, make you sick to your stomach chocolate syrup taste. As for parking we parked on the road (pay to park) but were able to find a space pretty easily. Will definitely come back!!!

A8tsND7xU4pVWuOroZaaCg.text: Welp, that makes two disappointing meals from Pike's.  The first time, wanting to try a new place, we tried the Thanksgiving turkey, mashed potatoes, etc dish. We also ordered a veggie plate, which never showed. First off, the portions were tiny. $14 for a meal about the size of the tray I used to have to eat in middle school. The taste and effort put into the food seemed about on par, as well. I LOVE the quintessential Thanksgiving spread, and I would never ever order this again, The Oreo milkshake, however, was pretty good. Dairy Queen is better, though, if you're looking for an Oreo kick.  The second time, I felt like a milkshake. I ordered the Oreo milkshake (with malt, I though)... and my milkshake had neither malt nor Oreo. It did, however, have chunks of ice, and it tasted like when ice cream defrosts and then gets re-frozen. It's lost that creamy consistency and is just sort of sweet and powdery/icy. What the heck? Food? Per someone's review, the Honey Pecan Fried Chicken was a must-try. Let me tell you, it's really not. It's a slab of chicken which by itself is pretty tasteless. The size and the texture of the "slab" was again on par with middle school cafeteria food. The honey pecan is simply a really watered down syrup with chunks of pecan in it. Really? What a disappointment. Mashed potatoes tasted like they were either really pretty old or they were made from a box. Broccoli casserole was just really salty. And that was $11!   If you are the kind of person who typically enjoys sub-par food, microwave TV dinners, and disappointing cafeteria food, this is the place for you.   Don't expect your order to be made correctly, and don't expect wonderful food. Expect a lot of sugar and calories that weren't worth the time and effort you spent masticating.

nhar8Z9GG2_MJ27zpEBKKg.text: A coworker invited me to this spot tonight. The workers were nice, but I was not impressed by the food . Initially I ordered a black bean burger, but it was sorta mushy and didn't have a good taste to it. I sent it bk and got a salad, fried okra, and green beans. The okra wasn't bad. I took two bites of the salad, tried one bean, and ate a few pieces of the okra. I was obviously displeased with my food, but I was still charged full price, even extra for guacamole on a burger that I didn't even eat. Oh well, I probably won't go back, but the waiter was handsome and smelled nice.

sEOre0N-X0lCvJYbgS1JAA.text: I love Pikes, it's very nostalgic. I've ordered many things here but I have to say that their fried pickles are simply addictive. I crave them. I'm a huge fan of their onion rings as well. The vibe is also fun and the old diner nostalgia I just love.   FYI: Shallow Hal was filmed here.

f4daDN7P8ZOy_CVz-iO74g.text: Not my favorite place. The staff was poorly trained and didn't know how to ring me up and the management were very condescending and it was made clear why no one could assist me on their own. Food was ok at best and don't get me started on the milkshake.

TM5Cz65FANuqd0VcHwU3AA.text: Let me start off by saying that I'd been waiting to try this place for a while and I had very high expectations.   And it all could have been what I ordered...but for me this place was just okay. I'm allergic to pecans so their signature dish of Honey Pecan Chicken was out....but since I just had to try their milkshakes I opted for a chocolate shake and the Panther Burger (Black and Blue) with fries.   I substituted a turkey burger for their regular patty. The burger comes only topped with blue cheese but I added lettuce and onions. For me it was just too dry and I could have used a little more seasoning. But the milkshake was tasty, very thick thick and creamy and the fries were crispy and hot. But overall I'm saying A-Ok.   I'm totally willing to give them another chance, order something different and have another milkshake. So stay tuned for the update!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Panther Burger (Black and Blue)

brPK-bJIRUZoNskYeVqM5g.text: Pikes has been a go-to place for us for many years. Today was the first time we were disappointed. Usually so quick to refill dishes, several pans stood empty the whole time we were there. Many of the others were barely warm.  The gentleman at the door very politely greeted us and held the door for new arrivals. On a cold morning, with no  lids on some of the trays, eggs Benedict get cold pretty fast.  Things were so different, I wonder if there's new management and they're still adjusting.  In any case, we'll wait awhile before we visit this former favorite again.

bl3RpjmFtKaXHyUSdIROig.text: Amazing food! While the pot roast comes with green bell peppers (not listed on the menu), we had to send it back due to allergies. The staff were so kind and courteous offering substitutions. I had the turkey dinner, my mother had the honey pecan fried chicken. Both of which were amazing!! When you go, you MUST get the broccoli casserole!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. They gave my daughter free ice cream!!

HbJDb1rm1vg0siSCj0wgvw.text: Well I'm torn with this place. My office came here for lunch. (13 of us) We arrived right at 12 and was seated pretty fast.  Our waitress was nice, however we had to ask for straws, napkins and refills.   A coworker and I ordered the Salmon Ceaser Salad, how could you go wrong? Well the salmon is was well charred I thought it would be okay but it wasn't neither of us was happy. I have this place 3 stars because everyone else enjoyed their meal. I heard the burgers are good, maybe I'll try that IF I go back.

uOMrsw4yMHS4uJIvRXdTwQ.text: Pikes is definitely South End's comfort food headquarters. The atmosphere is that of an old fashioned soda shop, complete with housemade orange aids, floats and shakes.  However,  dinner was amazing.  The open turkey sandwich is basically thanksgiving on a plate (although they have that too) and it rocks.  The onion rings are THE TRUTH.    I would definitely recommend stopping in and bring a hungry appetite.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Open-faced Turkey Sandwich.

vYzKQfH0FCOQvyegVoFk8A.text: Great atmosphere and friendly. Burger was delicious and huge. Root beer float was yummy too. Service was attentive and fast. I'll be back with the family.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Soda counter!

2i_JG4vgwyBH2Lo7qexr0g.text: Our office orders takeout from here frequently. The food is just okay. 8 times out of 10 the service is pretty rude. I came to pick up a large takeout order when they said it would be ready then was told to sit down because it wasn't ready yet. 20 minutes later I'm still waiting. I love to support local businesses but when the service is just not nice it's hard to come back.

SOQBbW0DVzyDX7I5mU9n7w.text: Loved this place.  I was in town on business for a day and wanted to get out of the hotel.  Swung by half an hour before closing  - sat at the bar and asked what type of malt she'd recommend.  The bartender made me a great root-beer malt.  Perfect amount of malt mixed in.  Delicious ice cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Root beer milkshake - damn fine

WnD9SbiIlkfZMsZNImaJUg.text: I had the Thanksgiving Dinner.  It was so good!  I totally cleaned my plate.  Parking on Saturday afternoon is pretty easy and free.  I think I'll try one of the fountain sodas they're known for the next time.  A friend of my swears the shrimp 'n grits are the best.  Pike's is also a budget-friendly place to go!

7ZJFDpN6zkxCZbXBuvPK7Q.text: Amazing time! Loved the food. The atmosphere is amazing. The staff so friendly and helpful. We went for my son's second birthday, we even brought our puppy who received the same courtesy as we did! I believe this is my family's new favorite place ever!

D5ES9tLJ1SOzVW0FxDaG0w.text: Amazing, great food!!!awesome atmosphere!!!! Our server was great!!!!! If you live little hole in the wall restaurant  with delicious food. This you definitely need to try out.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

YiBiY2rq74Y1kFo4MpSK3g.text: Just left this place and will NOT be returning!!!!! My boyfriend and I in all seriousness stood at the bar for 10 minutes before someone decided to acknowledge us. The lack of customer service the girl behind the bar offered was atrocious. She had zero personality and hated her life it seemed. As far as the ice cream we finally ordered to go, the vanilla malt was great, but the caramel sundae is horrid. VERY artificial tasting and the cup was literally less than half full with far too much "fake caramel.." Not to mention is was $5.99 for something I very well could have ordered at Mcdonalds for $1.00. We will never go back here. Shoddy customer service to say the least and less than quality ice cream. Ugh...

BhyQno8CnsOfKP2eDvwwmA.text: They take really good care of their customers, the club sandwich is great and there are a lot of salads and other tasty looking dishes.  Desserts look really good too.  I'm looking forward to coming back.

BzK2urS4rkU2KqQORn5sJw.text: Came here for a work lunch. Good, old fashioned,home cooking. I have also been to brunch here. Overall the food is good, the atmosphere- I really like, and the service is good. Somewhere I recommend coming, although you aren't missing anything if you don't stop by...

pFDUw7eA3_cySnt_B-UfHw.text: This is hands down my family's favorite casual restaurant in Charlotte!  We celebrate everything here: birthdays especially.  The food is great, the atmosphere is relaxing, and the staff is VERY friendly!  I especially love the quiche, salad, and muffin entree.  Food portions are generous, seating is great, and they have a separate meeting room if you need a place for a small function. The outside seating is great in the Spring.  My daughter loves the HUGE banana splits that can easily be shared by 3-4 people.  5 stars all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pike&#39;s Counter
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pike&#39;s

ILBZcP06Qlco1wdp19qaFA.text: The food is ok.  My daughter and I ordered a steak and cheese sandwhich and my husband ordered a chili cheeseburger and onion rings.  Our food was decent but his burger wasn't tasty.   I wish they made their own ice cream.  I come here for the brownie sundae which is huge and delicious!  I haven't tried their other desserts yet but they look good.

QvEakl-rc8NEckQ-F9B3lg.text: Love the Sunday brunch! Staff keeps the buffet well stocked despite it typically being quite busy. French toast casserole, hash brown casserole, broccoli casserole...oh my! yum yum & yum! Of course, they also have the usual brunch staples as well: scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, fresh fruit, biscuits & gravy & much much more. My only disappointment were the eggs benedict. Its hard to keep something like that on a buffet line in mass production and have it be delicious, in my opinion. It was 'okay'.  A little on the plain side for me. There is SO much more to choose from, so overall I say... it's fabulous!! (and all for $13.95....what?!)

uDJVq7WtVEb6QkTSFS4S6g.text: Came here for dessert with a group on Saturday night. The waiter that welcomed and seated us was super friendly and asked if we'd been before (we hadn't) so he gave us a little history and gave us great seats at the bar. I split a brownie sundae and still couldn't finish! Absolutely delicious ice cream and brownie and very good service. Cute area and atmosphere with some local history. The entrees looked really good too- next time...

DPi8WslmmqLWoBd0gpwnmw.text: I've been here 3 times and they are always sold out of the pot roast.  It must be really good.  And now I don't think I'll be in Charlotte for a while.  You have to get an old fashioned phosphate soda.  Cherry coke or vanilla coke are good bets.  The Italian sodas are also yummy.  Oh and get a coke float.  They serve you a Mexican cola (pure sugar!) and let you keep the bottle!  Well the ice cream is very soft and the float is frothy.  Seriously, don't just get a water.  Would you go to a bbq place and get a salad?  Oh you would?  Nevermind then. The food is definitely above par.  And they have great cupcakes and desserts.  The ice cream is good although it's not homemade, it's very soft and delicious.  Ok here's one thing... they claim to have the best grill cheese.  Some magazine rated it or something.  It's really not the best.  So we were a bit disappointed.  Just throwing that out there in case you were gonna go just to check that out.

KDBPjRrA8YwdEilNbkQ7cw.text: Pike's is right behind my office and when I don't feel like driving somewhere or just want some good comfort food for lunch, this is the best option.  The grilled cheese is really pretty awesome!  It's got two kinds of oozy, gooey super melted cheese on it.  And when I ask for it to be well done, it comes out perfect, yay!  The pecan fried chicken is another good one.  Its sweet and savory, and all kinds of bad for you but hey sometimes you gotta splurge!  It comes with a broccoli casserole which is also delicious, and the mashed potatoes, which I do not love.  But that's okay you can sub a different side for $1!  Desserts are very tempting.  So far though I have resisted, except I was given a slice of the mousse cake for my bday fro my boss, how could I say no to the boss??  Its a cheesecake with layers of the chocolate mousse, it was really silky and smooth tasting, very decadent and very delicious.  Luckily I had co-workers help me eat it.  The prices are very reasonable here.  Service is hit or miss.  I feel like they just drop you check right after you get your food, which is odd because I eat lunch at off peak times so its not like they need the table.  No matter, I sit and read and enjoy my food and leave when I am ready.  Otherwise, everything else is great!

VrGXHiCOf4_v4yrf2j0x7A.text: I would give them a 1 star for the service but the food was good.  Others were sat before us and we were told a 15 minute wait.  After 45 minutes we decided to order to go!  It took them 35 minutes to get our to go food.  We were constantly ignored by the hostess and the people behind the bar.

qBCqj7lR4zvAN6mjbS9mOg.text: **NOT gluten-free friendly** (must be able to order creatively to eat here)  We went here for brunch, but there was virtually nothing a gluten-free girl could eat, so I ordered an omelet instead. It was good, but came out luke-warm.  I ordered hot tea, and was brought generic black tea (I'm used to having a choice) in a teeny mug.   Overall, I wasn't impressed, but at least it was sustainable!

ilJyBJ4ctSQFVzPeNcajEg.text: Food was ok, but the atmosphere is great! We ate at the counter and the kids loved it!

P2Tg7ngoHDdZgeRqaSSHkw.text: Family outing....  Goods: I had the meatloaf sandwich, come on any place that has a meatloaf sandwich on the menu starts at 4 stars without even trying and I'll work from there.  I also had the Onion rings which where top notch also.  On the healthier side...we got milkshakes and the Chocolate one was nice and thick where you had to spoon some of it out.  Nice place to visit. They have done the decor to try and date the store to the old soda shops which is nice to look around and enjoy.

ApCTdJoi9wu6wC2nEq2UMQ.text: Great place! In the mist of a lazy Saturday, I wandered in for some good food. I had a bacon grill cheese and black bean and beef chili. It was excellent! The grill cheese was perfect, nice and gooey cheese with semi-crisp bacon. The new manager, Mike, stopped by and chatted with me a couple times. He is very sociable and seems like he will have Pike's serving good food for many meals to come.

VOgTXAnwi29_-_uwQLJjHA.text: On a hot summer day, you can easily gulp down a couple orangeades!

-ki9_Q2aj7vdj3tg8PJ0KA.text: Great atmosphere and service. One of the best milkshakes in Charlotte.  I recommend Pike's any day of the week

KQoqQ4JwUulKM1-qO5PdBw.text: At 8.95 for brunch , we thought it couldn't be bad , BUT WE WERE WRONG.  Expired cereal boxes on buffet, only regular milk, no sugar free syrup.  Few breakfast choices, lunch items begin at 10:00,we left at 10:30 and they still were not ready.

I7exrw7aurO_me4cgnTWfQ.text: I recently bellied up to Pike's Sunday brunch buffet. It was a beautiful day to sit on the patio and watch the world go by as I savored a hearty meal from the $13.95 buffet. One table features traditional breakfast items like grits, blueberry French toast, eggs benedict (not the best since English muffins get tough after sitting around for awhile), bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, fruit salad and fluffy biscuits to serve as a vessel in a sea of sausage gravy. The other table featured roast beef, sweet potato casserole, brocoli casserole, black eyed peas, and green beans. And if you save room for dessert, there are tiny morsels of freshly baked carrot cake, red velvet cake and key lime pie.   Service is great and beverage glasses never got low. Plates were continously cleared away.   I am a big fan and can't wait to go back.

FJfD6FYs8wgrl_IUsKTsfw.text: I had never bothered to check out Pikes mainly because they seemed like a typical shake and burger joint. Man, was I wrong. Here's what you need to know: #1 Everything is homemade (even the salad dressings and the ice cream). #2 The honey pecan chicken is like foodie crack it's so addictive. That's all I get when I go there. #3 The people and atmosphere. Like hearing yourself? Enjoy super nice wait staff? Don't want to feel crowded or have to wait? They got you covered. #4 The shakes. They really are worth it. The cherry with black cherry ice cream is my favorite. Try this place. You'll be hooked.

y3OMDDnCYnXgKxUeU3ZYbw.text: On a recent business trip to Charlotte, we had lunch at Pike's, per someone that used to be a local.  As soon as you walk in, you feel like you're in an old tried and True soda shop.  The place was packed at for lunch and as much as we wanted a solid lunch before heading back to Charleston, the dessert display and menu was hard to ignore-- cakes, pies, cobblers, ice cream, sundaes, milkshakes, malts, sodas... oh my.   After much contemplation I ordered the vegetable plate.  Not to worry, the only reason I did was so that one of my sides could be the mac and cheese (a special that day).  The sweet potatoe casserole was just as good as my mom's, the greenbeans were awesome, and even my side salad didn't dissapoint.  Everyone else got the hot turkey plate (massive portions of stuffing, mashed potatoes, turkey and gravy) and the pecan fried chicken (boneless chicken breast breaded in a crispy pecan crust and choice of side).  Everything was homemade, delicious, and not a single one of us could finish.   Then dessert.  I skipped, but fortunately my friend with the Tollhouse pie was very generous.  It was something just shy of heaven and automatically came a la mode w/ no extra charge (huge brownie points).  Again, everything was fresh, homemade and very satisfying to the soul. There are lots of healty options at Pike's as well.  I noticed a lady next to me had ordered a salad topped with blackened salmon.  She too was enjoying a very generous portion of food but in my opinion had no idea what she was missing... or maybe she did and that's why she was eating a salad. Lucky for Charlotte, Pike's is not a chain.  Next time I am in town, I will go back to Pike's for good service, great food, and lots of calories... no salad for me, thank you. I hear their brunch is stellar, no surprise.

WZduWB43iLhwLy6j1LV5KA.text: I always love coming here. Service is always good and the food is always on point. The honey pecan chicken is to die for. And the baked good and of course, bottled Cheerwine.

PNqK7-ltAHCIzIVnJE45Jg.text: Maybe it's a Southern thing but the attentiveness of the service bordered on surreal. 60 percent of the time, I'll take that everytime.  I had a solid Chicken Salad sandwich, my wife had a Turkey Burger she enjoyed, and our 3 kids all had kids meals they liked, although they are not picky eaters.  The Vanilla Bean milkshakes push this spot to 4 stars.  And what's not to like about the old timey diner vibe?

UqNxUObKc5zlWGrSu71stA.text: This place really makes me feel at home. The food tastes just like the food my grandmother used to make. I love the honey bread and sweet butter they bring to your table and the chicken tortilla soup is the best I've ever had. You are given your glass coke bottle with your coke floats and the service is top notch. If you want a taste of home without having to cook, Pike's is your place.

ECYn3CTPzhznpMW9WDnEiQ.text: I really enjoyed the soda shoppe atmosphere of Pike's.  We brought some friends here just for dessert and I thought it was so cute!  I had a craving for something sweet and this place was exactly what I needed.  I got a great feeling the moment I walked in the door and could see most of their desserts on display inside a glass counter.  And they sell cupcakes if you're into that fad.    We were seated right away and our waitress was awesome.  She was so sweet and very quick to bring our drinks and subsequent refills.  I ordered the chocolate, peanut butter and banana milkshake recommended by another yelper and it was very tasty.  Most of it was well-blended but it had chunks of banana which I liked.  The hubby got a brownie hot fudge sundae that was amazing.  One friend ordered the gooey pumpkin cake and it was delicious as well.  I'll have to come back sometime and try some food if I can restrain myself from ordering a huge dessert.

mlWRbDa9ifZ7Hj5JWCyMpg.text: I'd never heard of Pike's, so I had no objections when my mom and I stopped by last week, killing time before dropping me at the airport. We'd already had lunch, so we got dessert. Now, the main brownie a la mode sounded to die for, with whole 3 scoops of lactose intolerance lighter fluid. But I was sensible: I asked for a brownie with one scoop of ice cream. No stomach aches for me, and it was one of the best brownie a la modes I have ever had. And so big! I mean, there's no way the two of us would have been able to finish the one on the menu, but we devoured what we had. I hope to be back soon to experience the delectability again!

wOvxRwh0ch5GOzoR8xvl7A.text: Just had Sunday brunch here with my young family. Great soda shop atmosphere. Excellent cheesy potatoes and broccoli casserole. Frankly, everything we tried was delicious. Kids got ice cream with their meals and I topped mine off with a perfectly tart key lime pie. Trinette was our waitress and her service was outstanding and exemplified southern charm.  This has been on my Ohio-headed-south hit list for a few years and I'm so glad we stopped. Very reasonably priced.  A little windy today or we would've sat on the patio and watched the trains go by.  Will come back.

BYjyIjv2j7BktHSGcXkZbw.text: The honey pecan fried chicken is the best in town. Lived here my whole life. The desserts as well:)

nrH_qT45jn5GRXtYlJswYA.text: Now this is why I use Yelp.  Pike's is an upscale rendition of an everyday soda shop / diner.  With its fancy brick South End building right off of the light rail line, you might mistake this place for some frou frou joint that serves burgers with "aged artisan cheese".  You'd be wrong.  For lunch on most days, Pike's deliver an excellent burger and shake meal.  Finish off with a red velvet cupcake or a slice of pie and you'll be in glutton heaven.  That said, the real show here is Sunday brunch.  Wanting to show my visiting parents a good Charlotte breakfast outing, I took a risk in taking them to Pike's.  I'd heard good things on here about the Sunday offerings but never had them in person.  Oh man, did this bet pay off.  Their $9 breakfast buffet has everything from blueberry french toast, eggs benedict, sausage and bacon to hashbrown casserole.  If you get there after 10AM and fork over $14 instead, you can chow down on all of the above PLUS roast beef, sweet potato casserole, green bean casserole and lasagna and more.  Lasagna?  WHAT?  The best part is that all of the food is crazy delicious.  I mean three-plates-full delicious.  The kind of breakfast you walk away from kind of hazy, unsure if your legs are still gonna work.  Sunday here is simply awesome.  Any other time, it's still pretty good.

TbvWFdW1AomKnY-FSg3K6A.text: Cute, old-fashioned soda shop Uptown! Good service, great display of desserts right when you walk in. Lots of neat stuff on the menu. I tried a hand-stirred Pepsi with chocolate flavor add-in. Not something you can find just anywhere! Tasted just like it sounds: Pepsi with chocolate. The red velvet cupcake had a tangy strawberry jammish filling - tasty!   Come if you like desserts and oldies music. They've also got a full menu if you want a meal. Cute, colorful umbrellas in the outdoor seating area as well. Enjoyed this place very much, thank you!

mS_Bn9Cj9uxd8Kckqc9UGQ.text: My wife and I liked the casual outdoors atmosphere. We were seated and waited on by Wyatt, who was warm, engaging and helpful. We never had to guess where he was or when our drinks or food would show up.   I had the chicken pot pie special and it was very good, with a nice flaky crust. My wife had the southern fired chicken salad and liked that too. The house-made potato chips and potato bacon soup were very good also.  The prices were fair and when we're back in town, would definitely consider a return visit.

4UO1i445aLbiPiepClDGqQ.text: Delicious. The food was great, but during the weekend, the service is slacking. There wasn't enough servers for the amount of people there. But for the food. It was amazing. I would suggest sharing the brownie sundae, IT WAS HUGE!!!!

Ux26pBiBLzp_-X7Z8w0dLQ.text: My boyfriend would give Pike's 4 stars I'm sure, but I like my food a little healthier. We both got the honey pecan friend chicken, he got green beans and mac, I got mashed potato and broccoli casserole. The chicken was tasty and unique, the honey pecan sauce was really good but it could have been drizzled on more than poured. My sides were rich, but his green beans were fantastic. I drooled over the chicken pot pie and will most likely probably try it when I go back.   The dessert selection includes all my favorites and I can't wait to go back for one or two. So if you are just thinking of desserts one night, this is the place to go.   I will definitely return.

8MF02vnDYOn8ZrnUkYIekQ.text: I don't know why I don't come here more!! The food is always good and the service is excellent!!   Came in Yesterday for lunch and had the soup of the day which was the broccoli cheddar, soo good!! I had a BLT that was made on homemade white bread and was served with hand-cut french fries soooo good and filling!! My boss and sister both got the Chicken Fantastic they also really enjoyed they'res!!

TmLGI-Xetleg_XHtObjgdg.text: OVERRATED. We saw this place on a tv show talking about fun places to go in Charlotte. So we thought we would take our 4 kids there to experience the rave about the Fountain Drinks and have a good lunch. The Fountain cokes were just ok. I could have went to a gas station to get the same taste in a soda. The food tasted ok but the portions were super small. They brought out the kids meals on old warped trays that made me feel like we were eating in a jail or institution of some sort. The service was slow and the wait was too long! We won't be going back there. Very much overrated!

zklHQZWJs4H4qXKriB9-Cg.text: Service is friendly here but the food was just average. Honestly I was expecting more from the menu, the "chicken fantastic" was just "chicken blah blah". By this I mean it was nothing special, tasted like something I would whip up at home if I was in a hurry. Milkshakes are the best, this is what they are known for.

J3mZpcX6EBMJvylFuVw_fA.text: Visited Pike's (yet again!!) for their Sunday Brunch.  My husband and I visited on Valentine's Day afternoon thinking that they would have been done and over with brunch, but to my surprise, it was still going strong! The brunch was the best that I have had in a very VERY long time. Real scrambled eggs, gravy, grits, apple compote, bread pudding with syrup, bacon (just like Gram's!), fresh fruit, eggs benedict...and a carving station, lasagna, green beans (my favorite), sweet potato casserole--should I keep going? Is  your mouth watering yet? It should be. I finished two heaping plates of food. So did Dan.  I felt Spritely during my visit--maybe that is because I ordered a hand stirred Shirely Temple. When I thought I was finished, I wasn't. There was a dessert bar too! I went for the Carrot Cake. Truly wonderful! Cream Cheese icing and all.

QPqkozmwRF6NBadtHT5Rtg.text: I recently moved to Charlotte for law school and have been on a quest to find some great restaurants.  This by far has been one of the best. It's nostalgic; the food is awesome; and to top it off the staff is friendly and remembers you as soon as your head hits the door. I'm glad I came. I now decree myself a full fledged regular guest.

5WGHIEkrLNWWOSARSvcWWg.text: I am a fan of this place!! I had the best Chocolate shake EVER!!! Our waiter was funny and up beat. We also had the chicken quesadilla and it was great. If we go back to Charlotte we will be going back. Parking was a small issue that is the ONLY reason I didn't give them 5 stars.

oJiuGg-KeDKyOKgnmAwaJQ.text: I've been here a few times and it truly is A-OK. I tried the Hawaiian chicken sandwich on my most recent visit. A chicken breast topped with a grilled pineapple and red onions. The flavor was good but the chicken breast was so thin and kinda of dry. I enjoyed their house made chips. The wife got the pot roast. She loved it. The deserts look great but I haven't tried those yet. Maybe on the next visit.

OpiVCqX0DbVeV_6luhDoKQ.text: Pike's Soda Shop is a fun dining destination located in Southend right on the light rail line between Tremont and West Boulevard. I recently enjoyed a tasty lunch here and look forward to returning for brunch and to sample the famous ice cream, especially the milkshakes! Service was professional and efficient and the chicken quiche made for a satisfying lunch with the accompanying side salad and muffin. I didn't taste the reuben ordered by my dining companion but it also looked great. I love the ice cream sodas here. Kids will enjoy sitting at the old-fashioned ice cream soda fountain counter and the lovely patio is available for outdoor dining. On Sunday Pike's is open earlier for breakfast and brunch.

EHIg3P0BWD7j6wEh7xTVAg.text: Honey Pecan Fried Chicken with broccoli casserole and mashed potatoes is DIVINE! Love this place!

EF8m92OQDhK4gwJ_gPPjwg.text: Today was my first time visiting Pike's and I have to say, it wasn't the best. I initially ordered one of the house specials, Honey Pecan Chicken. It came with a dude of mashed potatoes and broccoli casserole. The broccoli casserole, I wouldn't even try. It literally had a pool of grease and just looked disgusting. The mashed potatoes were bland, but sadly came in far above the chicken. It just wasn't good at all. Luckily, they were very nice about swapping out my meal, and I got chicken tenders instead. Again, not much flavor, but leaps and bounds above the honey pecan chicken, and I was hungry, so I ate them. To finish, and to boost my opinion of Pike's, we shared a mint chocolate chip shake. I wish I could say it was good, and it was, until I found a hair in it! :( Pike's just isn't the place.

ewCxm7PDY6cTND-qfT8Wfg.text: This is a great old-fashiony style restaurant with great prices. They have good food and a great atmosphere. This is a good spot to stop in for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or even a quick dessert!

WjCW9ZWwqRSwrruGdiv5nQ.text: We had a great time at Pike's. We stumbled across the restaurant when the first restaurant we wanted to go to was closed. The food was great, the prices were extremely reasonable and the service was wonderful. We sat outside and had a great time people watching and enjoying the atmosphere. The burgers were really great and finishing out the evening with a milk shake and a walk down the light rail path was perfect. The location makes the restaurant and I would highly recommend Pike's for a date night to anyone in the Charlotte area.

emnNuALp6H83u7O7hnMYGQ.text: A step back in time!  Delicious food and great, friendly service.  After receiving a warm welcome when we stepped through the door, we were quickly seated at a comfortable table, and left with our menus.  Our server came immediately, greeted us, and took our drink orders, which she promptly delivered.  We opted for a couple of extra minutes to peruse the menu, as this was our first visit to Pike's.  I ordered the Honey Pecan Chicken with mashed potatoes and broccoli casserole and my husband chose the Buffalo Chicken with fries.  Everything arrived quickly and as ordered, and was delicious!  I ordered a old-fashioned chocolate soda, which was a disappointment to this northern girl.  I'm used to ice cream, chocolate syrup and soda water, which was what I thought I would be getting.  Instead, it was chocolate syrup mixed with Coke and served over ice.  Lesson learned.  Overall, our experience was great and we plan to return.  I would highly recommend Pike's for a casual dining experience!

MN6zUizXl_zoEIPHtCR2Uw.text: Yes! First time at this eatery. Starting with service and seating, my party of two was immediately seated and needed no reservation. Our waitress was attentive and responsive. I had the Sunday Brunch buffet. Everything was delicious. There was no butter on the buffet and when I asked the floor manager he didn't say he'd take care of it or have some sent over. He said "I'll bring some right to your table", and he did . Great customer service! All of the items on the buffet were great. From breakfast to lunch to dinner, all were right on the money. I' ll definitely return!

dw6ovNCgkvqwFBy5WPGY8w.text: I have been here a few times and have enjoyed everything each visit.  The service is good.  There is always a hostess waiting and pleasant to greet you.  There is never much of a wait, except Sunday brunch buffet-but that's to be expected.  It's never that bad anyway.  The food is delish.  The milkshakes and fountain soda drinks are very good.  I love the cherry phosphate.  It takes like a cherry Coke, only more tasty, and a lot of cherry flavor.  Must do Sunday brunch if anything, they have it all!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate malt, my favorite!!!
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

Se6FGsA92drMMZQ-X5wXkw.text: This is a great little place for any meal. The inside is a fun diner-y set up. They have a decent size outdoor patio area too!  I ordered the honey-pecan fried chicken which is served with mashed potatoes and broccoli casserole. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. The chicken was crispy on the outside and super moist inside, and the honey-pecan sauce was awesome. The broccoli casserole was also on point.  My wife ordered the Hawaiian Chicken sandwich, which was good. A pretty traditional "Hawaiian" choice with pineapple and bacon. Chicken breast could have been a little bigger.  The hand spun milk shakes look amazing, definitely going to have to get one next time we go. I hear their sunday brunch is a hit, have yet to try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey pecan fried chicken served with mashed potatoes and broccoli casserole.
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hawaiian chicken sandwich

v1bQCqrFuGvvr_Jcl4bpog.text: Solid choice for lunch.  Open til 9 or 10 on fri/sat.  Street parking for the most part.  smoked turkey reuben...good flavor, but turkey is chopped from slices?  not enough meat.  Bread stated marbled rye, but it was just rye, which is fine...thick, but truth in advertising...or menu description, anyway.  broccoli casserole good.  build your own burger available.  lots of good menu items... wine and beer.  a little heavy on the oil in the broccoli casserole and on the bread for the sandwich and on the chips (homemade tho, so that's a plus)

cAT1L9Olp3NZq_RZf2H2aQ.text: My wife and I have been coming here for the Sunday Brunch buffet for a while and in several years, it has not changed. It's still going to be crowded during the busy hours, there isn't much of a place to wait for your table and the offerings on the buffet are the same. Consistency, in this instance, is good.  The Sunday brunch includes the usual eggs and grits and sausages and bacon. Then you'll find a sweet potato casserole, meaty lasagna, hand carved roast beef (with horseradish!), broccoli casserole, bread pudding and more. And of course, you can keep eating until you're stuffed.  Wine and beer available (after 12:00 of course) or just go with the coffee or Pepsi products. Service is good at refilling drinks and clearing dirty plates.  Enjoy!
