Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunday Brunch at Pike&#39;s

jRgBaGyfTtPJkn7R2eFddQ.text: So I came in the other day to pick up an online order for Postmates. The bartender, Constance, was clearly overwhelmed with a busy Friday afternoon lunch and a new trainee. I waited patiently for my client's food to be ready; I'm fine waiting in a busy restaurant.  Eventually my client's food was ready, and I watched in dismay as Constance ignored it on the expo line minute after minute. My daytime job is at a full-service restaurant; I am very aware of the concept of 'dying food'. As I watched my client's order (chicken fingers and fries) slowly die in the window, I figured I'd ask another employee to hand me the food. After all, it had already been paid for, I just needed to take it to the client. Just hand me the food and I'll be on my way.   Constance noticed when I tried to grab a manager's attention, and said, "No no no, I've got it, it's just Postmates," and shooed away the person who was trying to help me.  I'm sorry... what?   A) I'm sorry (not sorry) Constance, you did not 'have it'. You were clearly weeded and needed help, but your pride got in the way of good customer service.   B) "... 'just' Postmates"? Really? REALLY, is a Postmates customer not adding to your revenue? Is the customer I'm representing not worth your time? If you give ME, the Postmates driver fresh and quality food, then your customer gets fresh and quality food. Not lukewarm soggy fries and tender.  All in all, this interaction gave me a very poor impression of this restaurant. I got the impression of a restaurant that has no vision of the big picture or guest experience. Management should have stepped up and helped her, or they can keep guests feeling like an imposition.

S4p9gEWT2Y39x9DMJw6qnQ.text: So, while on a mini getaway with my husband to Charlotte, Sunday morning we decided to go to brunch buffet before heading back to Atlanta. We both saw this restaurant on websites and Yelp so we decided to give it a go.  The display was cool - a little janky because some of the dishes holding the food were broken or hard to get into.. One or two didn't even have covers because they were off to the side ripped off. Wretched, I know! Nonetheless, there weren't many people so the food was abundant.  First round I tried the scrambled eggs, coffee cake, bacon, hash brown casserole, grits and a ham on an English muffin with a poached egg  (forgot what these are called because I normally don't eat it - but as soon as I was typing it.. Something benedict came to mind lol). These were all pretty darn good. I really enjoyed the casserole. It was nice and cheesy. I got some as soon as it came out so it was best fresh.  Second time around, I went and got a few different things.. This time I got some warm apples and a biscuit with gravy. The gravy was pretty bland but the biscuit was fluffy. Catch 22!   I wouldn't come here again because there are so many places to eat in Charlotte but this spot does have that old soda shop feel, so I'd recommend it for the experience.

QkWmcGARmvEoZG1wsBavjA.text: Tried to order through Yelp / Grubhub.  Error message received asking to wait and order later.  Didn't ever work.

GMYqZO3stn8xb9ZZ-JncEQ.text: Great food every time and the best service from Chris as well...  our brunch spot Sunday funday!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. WOW! Amazing fresh blueberry pancakes !

pVrZC8FNfYoq35VKmQ535Q.text: I love the grilled cheese sandwiches and my daughter LOVES the milkshakes. The location is hip and cool, the staff are always friendly and they remember who you are every time you go in.   I would suggest this spot for anyone looking for a low key, delicious meal in a pretty cool area of town.

_V1DF3tr3SY6xsyTGonAwA.text: Typical bar food. Cool atmosphere. My server was very nice. The coke float was really good.

FZVUkXmAwfnkPfBCT7E8hw.text: We've enjoyed both of Pike's Sunday brunches - their breakfast-only brunch (currently $8.95), and lunch-brunch (@ $12.95).  If you want breakfast only, you need to arrive before 10am; otherwise, you'll be charged the higher price.   We are usually not fans of buffets, but Pike's has lots of options.  Since they are so busy on Sundays, the food is always super fresh.  My favorites are their biscuits and gravy, cheesy hash brown casserole (absolutely delicious!), extra crispy bacon, and blueberry French toast.  I'm not a fan of eggs Benedict, but theirs looks pretty good, too.  Their butterscotch scones are reminiscent of the now-closed Pewter Rose's scones.  And on the lunch side, their lasagne and roast beef are very good.  Kali (Cali?) is a great server.  On one occasion, another server attempted to provide us with less change when we paid with cash.  Was she trying to hold back more to increase her tip?  I'm not sure, but it was very suspicious, because she immediately responded that she owed us more when we called her out.  Other than that, service has been very good.   I definitely recommend Pike's for Sunday brunch!  Now if we can only get out there for lunch or dinner one day....

a3oNPSkC4CMMS2HFC0kE1g.text: Stopped in here after Mr K's closed in our face.  We were hot and sweaty, served ice cold water with fast refills right away.  Got our order--and as usual I had mine customized to something off-menu--quickly and the check was brought immediately.  I had a strawberry-basil limeade so good and thick that you couldn't even see the basil at first.  Was so good I didn't even mind the bubbles.  The mint choco-chip malt wasn't that minty (which was great for me) and had HUGE actual chocolate chips in it.  She brought it out and poured it into the old fashioned glass from the large silver shake mixing cup right in front of us.  She left the metal cup on the table as it was still plenty full after filling the malt glass--nearly another malt's worth was in there.  And I really liked that it wasn't too thick to drink; I like my ice cream to have that oozy melted texture.  Perfect!

KHN5leyHZToVuFngx1Ewjg.text: It's simply a great lunch and dinner diner.  Wonderful waitstaff.  If you are in the mood for a wide menu of home style food mashed up with greasy spoon this is the place.

0ARJElhnwHXYVE3JZg3o2A.text: My wife and I decided to try this place when I really wanted an old-fashioned diner experience. It's located in a fashionable district, South End, with easy access by car or the light rail. Parking might be a problem if it was busier but we went about 3:30 pm on a Wednesday and found a good spot.   When you walk in, the decor in the front has an old school vibe mixed with some modern touches. We were seated in a quiet corner with a high backed booth that had a mirror after passing several cabinets with antiques.   The menu has a number of choices that are comfort food as well as specials like a Reuben and more. I had the turkey and dressing with mashed potatoes and black eyed peas and my wife had quiche with a side of mac and cheese. Both were very flavorful and delicious; very tasty!  I had the Coke float for dessert and it was so good (even if it was in a Pepsi glass...lol).   I don't know about others' experiences but ours was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey and dressing with mashed potatoes and blackened peas. Yum!

GXLszqIUu3zLaaQq6pM6hg.text: Appears that New Management has bumped up the menu prices?  Small portions of quality food at HIGH prices.   Oh, and it's a soda fountain so don't expect free refills....  NOT a do-over!

zDhg_9xgS6oacBCXbNLA_w.text: Pike place is decorated like an old fashion ice-cream shop with lost of memorabilia on the wall. (one wonders where does it all come from)  If you going for ice-cream sundays this is a great spot 5 stars all the way. They have lots of options and if you want a pie or so that is really great too. I got a key lime pie when I first stopped in.  The food is fine nothing I would remember but I am being told by the local it is standard good old fashion southern comfort food. That I give it 3 stars. I could be wrong and I will go back to try something else.  All in all I would go back, the people are nice the food is decent and I like places I can walk to easily.  This place is very dog friendly. They bring you dog a real water bowl.

ATeIebNY9QD8K5ONOdCC4A.text: If you come to Pike's be sure to request Kiki as your server. She has a beautiful personality and everything we ordered was her suggestion. I was between the meatloaf and a burger and Kiki suggested the meatloaf sandwich. The meatloaf was cooked to perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meatloaf sandwich and homemade chips

ET9J3x6VMWnr5MDiI6XTUw.text: We finally made it here and found it quite busy for a Labor Day lunch! We went because we were craving burgers and each went with a basic burger and fries. My husband got the American with bacon and I did the create your own with red onion and pimento cheese. The burger was flavorful and had great texture with the bun and cheese. The fries were nothing special but pretty good dipped in ranch. We sipped dessert after such an indulgent lunch but the ice cream and sundae options sounded delicious, the peach milkshake special of the day sounded wonderful. Overall, we had great service and a good lunch in a fun environment. We look forward to going back.

7oiv-fpAmfx6PTQeR7m11w.text: Skip the mac & cheese here unless you like bland kraft-style.  Super disappointing!  However, the blackened flounder tacos were tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Flounder tacos w/ mac &amp; cheese

qswRPJfwtIo0jM0nAeKqFg.text: Friday night was all you care to eat flounder. Very lightly battered and cooked to perfection!!! Some of the best yet. The other entree was what seemed like a mile high burger....yum. great service and atmosphere. Seafood topped off with a blue moon with an orange slice. Doesn't get any better than this

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Homemade chips and mile high burger...Yum Yum!

KM_SPd7GYiUm1tXKKnNcWQ.text: Awesome concept...a 50s style soda shop located in the heart of Southend. What's there not to like right? Wrong.  I must say that I truly wanted to like this place, but after 3 different visits I've come the realization that it will never happen. I do not claim to be a chef or an expert on food, but I know poor quality food when I taste it. Not only is the food overpriced, but about half of what I've tried here tasted as if it were microwaved. The only thing worth going to Pike's for is the root beer floats, but if you're hungry I suggest eating somewhere up the street instead of wasting your hard earned money here.  Giving 2 starts instead of 1 because of it's pleasant atmosphere.

fbDOeRwyKXhHCcpZoQg_Uw.text: We went here on a Sunday morning for brunch with some friends. Parking wasn't bad, we parked on the street. They weren't too busy and we were seated quickly. The interior was nice and homey, and the patio looked perfect was slightly less warm weathers.  I looked at the menu and got excited to see quiche there. So I ordered that. My boyfriend had the pimento burger. One of our friends had the Mexican omelet and another did the brunch buffet.  The quiche was okay. It wasn't bad, but I've had better quiche on multiple occasions. My boyfriend's burger was delicious. So much, that the piece that I tried, I saved a part of it to eat after I finished my quiche. The Mexican omelet looked good, but the brunch buffet seemed a little steep at $14 for the kind of stuff our friend had on her plate.  No milk options for your coffee, only whole milk or half-n-half... bummer.

ADQ_DLEvFErVoo-DWoibmQ.text: So I have to say, I like their shakes... This is how they are: drinkable! As opposed to the thick ones you get a headache from. They have a great soda shop bar to sit at with the kids. Very friendly place, nice new general manager. Great place for ice cream drinks and Sunday's. For food, it's good, but because of where they are there is just so much more amazing food close by I prefer this for the cute atmosphere and good desserts.

bdbVPbLRh-ZUod6QS6KegA.text: Nice place to eat with old fashioned flair and decorations. Service was great as well.  Went there around mid November and they had a turkey plate on their menu which was great. It was a complete thanksgiving meal for a price you can't beat.  Overall a nice experience and enjoy it every time I go.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey plate with broccoli casserole. Great meal

KDAnJXJFUn0pGHXWEIc7Og.text: During my first visit to Charlotte, NC I decided to take a friend's advice on a great lunch spot, Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop! I sat at the bar and had today's special of Shrimp and Grits and a Peach Milkshake to go. The food was delicious but the company was even better. The bartender was friendly and knowledgeable and even anticipated my requests before I made them. I can't wait to eat here the next time I return to Charlotte.

68MvN3FfObZtKfcQQKvD0Q.text: My family of 3 and I arrived today at Pike's for Sunday Brunch.  Upon arrival the 3 hosts informed us without a smile, eye contact, or any grace at all that the wait would be 15 minutes.  Another family arrived right after us and asked to be seated on the patio which was empty. While we waited beyond 30 minutes, 20 more people arrived all if whom were asked also to wait.  When it began to sprinkle outside I decided to look inside the restaurant. I was dismayed to see 6 open and cleared tables awaiting paying customers.  The wait staff were not working with any urgency at all and the 3 hostesses were certainly not at all interested in service.  My family and I left shortly after another family.   Strictly from a business perspective why would Pike's pay 3 hosts to treat customers so poorly?  Alienating customers can easily be achieved by paying 1 host.  When I called and asked to speak to management I was told they were too busy to speak to me.  Pike's food does not warrant enduring such treatment. Pike's is not distinctively better than other choices in Charlotte. There is no reason to return and my family and I will not.

5KoDivV0Zma_0WF-MDtoJQ.text: This place has been recommended by Poprock LOVE, Jeff S. and some people not on yelp and I had heard the Sunday Brunch was the time to show up for the After party!  On a Beautiful day you may notice plenty of people enjoying the Patio Dinning and we thought about it then went in so the snowman (me) did not melt!  Our Sever was so nice she gets SIX yelp Stars*** *** !!! and a kiss... She brought my Girlfriend a Biscuit for her Headache (we were at a wild Halloween Party I can not review, it would be a dead giveaway)!  The Biscuit gets at least four yelp stars!  We did NOT get with, nor go with the Buffet  Black Bean Burger... This was my first and it was good as in close to four stars  Hamburger, hmmmm, it was better than many, not as good as the Neighboring Big Ben, nor Liberty!  This Burger gets less than 4 stars only because for the price it does not get close to the competition!  The sides were OK like not quite 3 stars - Still I'm very glad we checked this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

ztEjY_uYygelGcEUURwt7w.text: Looking for something off the beaten path, here is it is. Best Grilled Cheese Sandwiches in Charlotte. Gooey and cooked just how you like them. Shakes are Freshly Spun and the Lemonade is great. This place is great for families or just a quick meal. Entrees 7-15. More of a casual place for lunch/dinner.

Ck4GeO-AXTgtEpr9F6QrIw.text: Pike's was on my list of top 3 locations to eat at on my trip.  I heard it was used in filming Shallow Hal and I was excited at the old fashioned soda shop atmosphere.  I was let down in all aspects.  The place looked like any normal restaurant and our waitress was annoying.  The food was average at best.  The coolest part was how the kids meals came out on school lunch trays.   I was really disappointed by the Carolina Burger I got.  It wasn't even in the top 5 burgers I had on my trip.  I left with a sour taste in my mouth and this time it wasn't from the food.  I give Pike's 2 Doubledays for crushing my dreams.

MPgHBXWwTP8AUk-aOi2blQ.text: Met a long time friend and his family there for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.....everything from the food to the service was top notch. Everything came out fresh and hot. I had the turkey Ruben which was excellent and my friends wife had their Thanksgiving every day meal and loved it. Highly recommend Pikes, will be back soon

mrRsGZtRUXE_mi4vXlUIJw.text: We had Sunday brunch buffet at Pikes a few weeks ago, I suggest you go before 11:30. They do accept reservations for parties of six or more. They have both indoor and outdoor sitting. We arrived shortly before 11:30 therefore we had no wait, upon leaving the line to be seated was out the door and extremely congested. I suppose you give your name to be placed on a list to be seated, that said it seemed most people waiting lingered around the door area. This made it a tad difficult getting through the buffet line as well as trying to get through the door to leave. I think there's very limited waiting space at the door although there were chairs for those waiting to be seated just outside the front door for those waiting to be seated. We were very pleased with our brunch especially considering it was a buffet we weren't sure what to expect. There were several different pastry type items to choose from, scrambled eggs, eggs Benedict, bacon, sausage, hash brown casserole (which was wonderful), a blueberry French toast that was wonderful as well. They also offered steam boat roast beef sliced for you as well as several other "non breakfast" type foods that appeared to look as good as the breakfast stuff. We were to full from our breakfast choices to give those a try. I'm certain there will be more trips to Pikes from us in the future. I should add although they are clearly busy for Sunday brunch our server was very helpful (this was our first visit) as well as attentive in refilling drinks and clearing our table of dirty dishes. Give them a try you won't be disappointed!!

WD3eEOgAAJ5Vm2_zr5Grlw.text: Eating here was such a poor dining experience in every possible way, I don't even want to take the time to leave a detailed review. We were there this past Sunday for the brunch. Suffice it to say, the food was not good, the service was poor, and the prices are high. You get the feeling that here not even trying. I will definitely not be going back.

DeCO09ok0HO5swjYzfKPUg.text: It was nice to sit on the patio on a beautiful afternoon and watch the light rail go by. Our host and server were super sweet and welcoming. The Cobb salad was great. I can't wait to move to the South End, get off of this diet, and order every fattening item from this tempting menu.  The movie "Shallow Hall" was filmed here. Sit in the actual bar stools where Gwyneth Paltrow and Jack Black sat, and order the brownie sundae. (Yes, we have abandoned the diet since my last post.)

Rh1w2s4_1qSSVfyBVHdD6w.text: Had a little day date with my boyfriend. I got The Quiche of The Day (spinach, mushroom & Chicken) which was AMAZING!!! Came with a side salad. My boyfriend had the Honey Pecan Chicken with broccoli casserole and mash potatoes. Everything was wonderful. Looking forward to going back here soon

3zPz-xl9YnszlFtUlO6QjA.text: Came here because I had a groupon coupon. I am all for the vintage diner feel and this place hits it! It didnt take long to get seated at all but while we waited we got to watch a gentlemen at the front make shakes. There was a huge menu above him that had countless of shake options to choose from. Once seated our waiter was very attentive and immediately came over to greet herself and take our drink orders. My children ordered from the kids menu and I ordered meatloaf and string beans. The meatloaf was excellent however wasnt too fond of the string beans. They were really bland with hardly any seasoning. I did order a shake orange creamsicle and it was to die for!   Will come again!

jnI6ftZFySuNYAL8I-87RQ.text: I've only been to Pike's for dessert so that is all I can comment on, but it was good. The place was set up like an old school type of diner so I would expect their menu to reflect this. I just ordered their tollhouse pie with ice cream on top. It tasted great. Most of the staff was good, although I received a plastic milkshake spoon(pictured) to try to eat with. I requested from one of the other waitresses an actual spoon and was able to enjoy my pie. I'd definitely go back for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tollhouse pie

hSwKSJVVCY15z2LDsV1qGQ.text: The day South End loses this place to the non-stop hipster construction and rebranding, we will have all lost something. I've ate here 4 times, each time was a day that started off with a craving for home cooked food. The least eventful memory was the quiche I ordered to go. Anyway, here and Midnight Dinner are where I've ended up on my diet-crashing days. Yesterday I took advantage of a GroupOn that has been sitting around. A mushroom Swiss burger with fries and a last minute call on a brownie sundae. I asked for the burger medium and it was just over into medium well but nonetheless, still juicy. Fries are pretty typical and came out hot with the perfect crispness. The sundae was insane and would be the perfect "date dessert" where you sit on the same side of the booth and feel utterly sinful together but oh no, yesterday it was all mine. And it may seem minor but I'm from Pittsburgh so having Heinz ketchup on the table instead of the Southern-preferred French's also helps compliment my Pennsylvania palette. Thank you Pike's for consistency, quality and always friendly wait staff.

1u7rpxcLwXriRYNPgM08RQ.text: Love the location of this restaurant.  It is in the trendy south end and right next to the light rail.   The counter and the stools and decadent desserts behind the glass display transport you to a by gone era.  I had a salad with  scoops of egg salad, tuna salad, and chicken salad.  It was a hearty portion and the side of fries that I ordered made the lunch a bit too filling.   It's not the first time I have been too full!   This would be a great place to come for dessert and a beverage at the counter.   It's definitely a casual place that is probably better than the local diners. A lot of food sandwich and salad selections.  Apparently the fried pickles are pretty popular here. Fun atmosphere. I would have given more stars had the service been better.  Our server never checked to see if everything was alright and I almost had to stand on my head to get a refill on the iced tea!    Anyway, I hope this place stays here forever. It deserves to have patronage!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

qp0j4G5Mph7xqyk4eXEznw.text: I must say that I started coming here in 1995 and have never reviewed it.  I happened to wonder in with my wife for Sunday Brunch.  From the moment we entered to the moment we left, the staff bent over backwards   The Brunch is divided with breakfast on the left and lunch on the right.    The breakfast is fantastic.   I am 100% a bacon and sausage snob, but this was some good meat.  Great bacon makes any meal spectacular.   The biscuits are fresh and the home made gravy, is a southern delight.  They had real scrambled eggs, cheesy hashbrowns, eggs benedict - all great.  I noticed they had thick French Toast, but did not partake.  The lunch side started with a cup of Tomato Bisque, add ground up bacon and it was a home run.   I just want to go on record, that this was one of the best prime rib steak meals I have ever had.  I walked by and thought, damn that looks good, but then I observed the carver placing "choice" cuts in the au-juice.  He served up some cuts that had been in for a while, because I cannot remember tasting such flavorful and tender meat.  Combined with their homemade horsey sauce is awesome....     They had some other lunch plates like lazonia, but I did not try.  I am looking forward to my next Sunday Brunch!

rLl7vWpsjn1_hHVen7a3gw.text: I ordered takeout and got the honey pecan fried chicken with the broccoli casserole and mashed potatoes and a peanut butter shake! The order was ready as soon as I walked in and the shake was waiting in the freezer. Everything was still hot when I got home. I got the honey pecan sauce on the side to prevent the chicken from getting soggy. The chicken was crisp and cooked perfectly. The mashed potatoes were awesome! As for the shake, I would go back for another one tomorrow! It was a great home cooked meal even though it was takeout!

5YJ4v6k4uuBqKGqHQLaqGw.text: The trip back in time to this city landmark is worth the visit..the food was better than ok (bison burger ) worth another try... Toll house pie is always worth the wait... service time from order to delivery was long (excess of 30 minutes)... Be patient

7b38a9C4C4atcIeuWvzHFg.text: Loved this place! It's a cute spot, like a deluxe diner. The staff was friendly and food was good. I had a limeade and the club sandwich, tasty! I tried my sisters buffalo chicken sandwich and it tasted like heaven! French fries are amazing as well. They made my sister and mother mimosas even though they aren't on the menu also.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo chicken sandwich
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Club sandwich
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. French dip

4ROIC0iBJMep05wfsCjnIA.text: Loved the atmosphere and concept! It was a great place to celebrate a birthday for an eleven year old. The food was great especially the peanut butter milkshake for dessert. It was by far the best peanut butter milkshake we had ever had.

1KnM5EctRkLLPqDTjEGZmw.text: I got the special quiche of the day which is pretty good.  I think it could be better with crust all the way to the bottom instead of just in the side.  Their chicken casserole that my boyfriend had was delicious and I liked how they put it in a clay pot to keep it nice and hot.  Their broccoli casserole is one of the best as well.  Will be coming back!

ODxs-glbIQkppkb-IDwDcA.text: Absolutely love Pikes! Their broccoli casserole is amazing and their milkshakes are the bombdigaty! Seriously I have just ordered a veggie plate before that was just 3 sides of broccoli casserole and a house salad; it's one of my favorite lunches!

a0rTPlEG8vKzU8IXZGVohw.text: Yum! Got the pimento cheese sandwich and fruit. Both were tasty. Husband had the salmon salad and it was huge. Tried the rootbeer float and one of the hand made Shirley temples. Good stuff. Nice waiter, plenty of tables. Convenient to the light rail. Will be back to try more of the menu.

L6eR4EtPIiHsO1_aciF0ig.text: After reading the great reviews, we decided to stop by Pike's. Lots of history here and overall a nice little place. Fast friendly service. Food came out so fast that I barely had time to finish appetizer and salad before entree. That's not a bad thing of course. The pimento cheese dip app was great!  Definitely worth a stop!

H4aJ5p6-kWRXD8VrdS0KQw.text: Pikes outdid itself today with service on the patio by Kia and visits from Chris and the lovely general manager - their smiles made the day extra special with our friend Brian and his black lab Jake ;) If you ever get Kia you'll be in for a treat but everyone at Pikes is exceptional for sure!  Check out the skyline from Southend - we love coming to Pikes for some soup and quiche, our faves. Sometimes we just get the milkshakes why the heck not? We are old enough to know better but old enough not to worry;) #CLT

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. My little Mamacita loves Pike&#39;s !

EUSsEYLLaBDsQFRmB3nzuA.text: Fabulous!!! Everyone is soooo friendly here and the food is delish. I loved it so much I'm bringing my best friend when she comes to visit. I ordered the peach milkshake which I think was a special on Saturday. It was very filling. I couldn't finish it and I also ordered the blackened fish tacos. The fish was flounder and great! I was impressed with the food. I didn't like that guacamole creme sauce of some sort that cake with the tacos, but it didn't hinder my experience. Overall I'll be back and I recommend!!

B8tmMKo4QBbYWiRC50rg2g.text: Had dinner here yesterday, and overall, I enjoyed my experience at Pike's. Good food, I ordered the honey pecan fried chicken with the baked Mac n cheese and broccoli casserole on the side. That casserole was really damn good. Now, would I had preferred my chicken be a leg quarter rather than white meat? Yes, but that wasn't a deal breaker. Good service and the prices wasn't too bad. When I left, I said I'll be back again.

fO0Gk0W5mcML_jozvnSRWQ.text: Pike's is a great breakfast and lunch spot, with options for everyone!  I have been recently for both lunch and breakfast and enjoyed both visitis.  I will say, check out the Chicken and Wild Rice soup, Friday's soup special. Although not advertised on the menu, I was able to get cup of soup and half sandwich. Chicken and Wild Rice Soup with a Grilled Cheese with Bacon.  The soup was so fresh and although it is cream base, not too heavy. As for the grilled cheese, cooked too perfection, with cheese melted perfectly. This past Sunday we stopped in for brunch. We arrived around 10 so sme items were still being brought out, but what a variety, fruit, scones, grits, eggs, bacon and sausage, eggs benedict, tomato basil soup and even a hot station with meats.  Items were kept filled and the service was top notch.  Come hungry and enjoy!

CDeKNA91QvN42RQw7yqJug.text: We decided to order out from Pike' s yesterday since we didn't want to go Uptown near the riots. Its near South End alongside the Lynx line, I didn't even know it existed! Thank god for foodie call lol! We ordered the shrimp and grits as well as the honey pecan chicken, had to get a vanilla malt shake is well. Basically, we didn't want to leave the apartment lol.   Food was ready quick, pick up was easy. Food was still hot when we brought it home. The broccoli casserole was soooo good! The chicken was crunchy. The sauce that came with the chicken was a little too sweet for me, I'd prefer it had a kick at the end. The shrimp and grits were generous in sauce and shrimp. The grits themselves were very creamy but, need to be seasoned a little more. The malt shake was good but, the one from Which Which is even better. Everything was delicious really. We would come back for more! Cheers!

xey75vicWmAEytQfZqWb5g.text: Love the concept of this place. I had a coke float and the ice cream in it was actually really good

5L90UT3H4rZ8THtHfCRISQ.text: Don't get me wrong, the server I had was great, he made me feel at home. His name was tommy, god bless him.  The food however! The food didn't seem terribly fresh, the fruit was soggy and old and the quiche tasted like someone heated it up in a microwave. The middle was icy cold while the outside was burnt.The tea and lemonade was painfully sweet, seems whoever made up the recipe is a near diabetic. The side salad I was served had wilted lettuce and some sad looking tomatoes which had decidedly seen better days. Don't get me wrong this place is a step above fast food but I'd appreciate if someone would act like they cared about the state of the food. Especially when my bill was $35.   So I'm sitting trying to enjoy this mediocre food and I hear yelling from the kitchen. We were situated so we could see in the swinging door where the employees came in and out. I hear this man screaming at people quite loudly. I assume it was the owner because he wasn't in uniform. Very unprofessional. Should spend less time yelling and more time updating the place, it's a mess.  This was my first stay here and I will definitely not be coming back again.

kW-Qu-t_ydZoK3kuKdS_9g.text: Recently had a chance to visit Pike's in the design district of South Charlotte NC. The food was excellent, staff very courteous and the menu had lots of things to choose from. The green bean casserole was great and my son had their famous grilled cheese. We had heard many good things about the eatery; yet, had never had a chance to stop by. Great for a mid day lunch or early dinner.

uMoICU78rBD46C3WjCz-Fw.text: Friendly service, and great ice cream desserts. The honey pecan fried chicken, and Friday night fried fish special are my families favorites.

AifElokfIHNBOW90QPFtTA.text: "One of the best burgers ever!" said my husband as chili fell from the burger and onto his plate. He ordered the Carolina burger filled with chili and coleslaw (strange combination, but it went well together). I got a freshly squeezed lemonade...satisfying!  My mom got a hot fudge sundae, but was greatly disappointed. The hot fudge was not thick and creamy as one would expect, instead it was like something out of a hershey's syrup bottle. In addition, she had to scrape the sides of the dish to get it.  It's conveniently located next to LYNX and makes a great stop to and from Uptown for a game or something. The atmosphere was cute and old fashioned. It was good food and a nice place to relax on their patio...just go somewhere else for dessert.

u-PDQpvUmVVrxImprdot5A.text: I love Pikes. I've been here a few times and am really never disappointed. It reminds me of some of the diners I used to go to growing up in Baltimore. The milkshakes are awesome and so is the delicious desserts they have up front. The past few times I've went I had gotten the chicken salad sandwich and it tastes fresh and had just the right consistency. It's definitely comfort food, but it's worth the visit in Charlotte!

3-CYucyA6tfp5vJbYorVFg.text: I was really looking forward to trying this place but was totally underwhelmed. The service was friendly but slow. I ordered a Carolina classic burger, which has chili and slaw on it. The burger came back with no slaw. My husband ordered the bbq brisket, which was presented on the menu as a dinner. It turned out to be a small sandwich, which was very dry and tasteless. The atmosphere is unique but it's not enough to compensate for the lousy service and lackluster food. I will say that their peanut butter  chocolate shake was excellent though.

R7OVI5Rar15I5WpQUYQrMQ.text: The ambiance....food and the Black Cherry Milkshake makes this place an A+! We had the Hawaiian Burger (which is like vacation in your mouth) and the Pecan Chicken (the BEST!!).  We topped all this off with the Black Cherry Milkshake that was beyond DELICIOUS!! Great service and personable staff. Yeah we will be back!

eH4Fn7Uxzn3fnHAlc0LKNA.text: Morgan rocks!  She waited on us one night and I told her I would put it in the review. :) So does that Honey pecan chicken. Yum. Pike's is a family staple. We come here at least twice a month to shoot the breeze. They have a soda jerk behind the counter, great ice cream, grilled cheese, fries, all those ol time favorites to go with the soda shop decor and a great staff that seems to never change. I love coming back and seeing the same smiling faces and getting that great service I have come to expect over the years. Thanks so much Pikes!

aqcgEnETZrFHHlN0sqxe3w.text: I seriously love this place! The food is great, the service is really good and they decor is really cute.   Plus, Pike's makes GOOD milkshakes. Not those crappy thin ones you get a most places. Yummy thick milkshakes where the chocolate is made the old fashion way- vanilla ice cream with fudge syrup.  When I went, I also got the Hawaiin Chicken Sandwhich, which was actually really good. I knew the desserts were the highlight, but they're food is also pretty good. One friend got the fried chicken salad and another got the turkey burger- I tried both and they were just as good as my meal.  I reccomend this place for families, friends and those wanting to go on a casual date.

2RbfGIZ7BnTcA-DikcTapw.text: I am a fan of Pikes!   Food: I love that they have an option for turkey burgers, and they are actually good! You can not say no to the beautiful display of desserts showcased. My boyfriend's favorite dish is Honey Pecan Chicken, Mac n Cheese, and other sides.   Service: The service and wait staff is always friendly. Depending on the time of day you may have a small wait.   Price: average $11-$16 per person   Location/ Parking: located on conveniently on the corner with plenty of street parking

RDU7cwd1_LZTl4Cd7PmRVQ.text: Pike's is really fun as it offers old fashioned foods, milkshakes and a to-die for brunch on the weekends. Their meatloaf is just as good as your mama's and their milkshake selection is enormous! All of their milkshakes are made by hand by a "soda jerk" and are super yummy. I highly suggest stopping in for their brunch buffet. It offers many different breakfast foods as well as a meat carving station. And the buffet is pretty affordable too, somewhere around $15 or so. Whenever I dine here, the place is always busy but the wait for a table is never too long as they also have an outdoor patio section that is nice to enjoy on a warmer day.   I say start with the brunch first.. then go from there. You will be back! :)

bNXCYKT6bYW9KyQx7DdrsQ.text: Typical diner fare.  This was the first time at Pikes for dinner.  I ordered the blackened fish tacos and paid an extra dollar to swap out slaw for sweet potato casserole.  The fish tacos were not very blackened and a small portion.  The flour tortilla was not warm and was eventually soggy.  My friend had the meatloaf sandwich and she said it was very good.  We passed on dessert which is sad since their chocolate cake is to die for.  I will go back but not for the fish tacos.

NTJMwhNY0TwAvwFN2MLh8A.text: Absolutely incredible! Great food, the best shakes in the world (seriously). A must try.

Pj6TvMTxWU2J8Nh5f9b8ag.text: Love this place.  I have been twice recently.  They have an outdoor patio and on a beautiful day, it is just fabulous sitting outside.  They have old fashioned food like meat loaf and turkey dinner to quiche and Sandwiches.  I have never had an I cream soda there but they look just like the ones I had as a child at an old time drug store counter. The BBQ sandwich was the special the last two times I was there and I got it both times.  Excellent BBQ. My husband had the meatloaf both times and really liked it.  My sister got chicken quiche and she said it was the best quiche she ever had.  I love the fact that they have the very fine crushed ice and great ice tea. I heard from a friend that they have great Sunday Brunch.  Looking forward to trying soon.  Good service.

k3rYrkteluh-gay4OT9RkQ.text: Our server Tommy was excellent.  He was knowledgeable and attentive.  The food was perfect family comfort food.  The turkey and honey fried chicken are excellent.  The beverages and desserts are just what you expect from a soda shop.  Perfect for a family meal.

Ry_0MhiDoY8KBaNy92-XHg.text: I highly recommend Pike's milkshakes and other desserts. The old-timey atmosphere is fun, but the service also seems to move at an old-timey pace. It often feels as though it takes forever for your basic meal to arrive. The food is good (I like the grilled cheese), but not amazing enough to wait that long.   It's packed on the weekends. You'll find tons of families and little kids there.  In the summertime, it's fun to sit outside and watch the light rail go by and enjoy a milkshake.

jn5jNvZ-v-uc_eV-N7pHlg.text: Solid 3.5- I've gone several times and overall have enjoyed it.  I've had the breakfast buffet in the past- and it's pretty darn good...but not good enough for me to think to recommend it unless someone is thinking of specifically staying in south-end.   Today for lunch I went with the pecan chicken. I too (like another reviewer) found it to be a bit overwhelming after awhile and would have liked something lighter on the side or for lunch (but that's my own fault). The mashed potatoes were luke-warm and the casserole was good but  very heavy. The chicken itself was very sweet - and the honey sauce can be a bit much after the first bite or two.   I really want to try the limeade/orangeade but at $3 a pop - I may as well wait till after I get off of work and get an alcoholic version for a dollar more. I think if they lowered that price a bit I would definitely go for it.   ...I do feel price-wise the chicken was a great deal at $8.95 - but the sandwiches were on the same price point as the entree- seemed odd?   Service was pretty good- we had a large group and he did a nice job about getting our meals out to us and handled the  separate check situation like an expert!   I still havent found a go-to entree but I will keep looking

4AXO4NWyLDtuHcNyCLg2wg.text: Looovin' yoooou, is easy because you remind me of home with your tasty food selection, doot'n doot'n do doooo....  It's True, though. Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop reminds me of the many, many diners that dotted my home town in Maine. I've grown accustomed to Southern food since I've been here, but I love me some yank options.   FOOD: Mmmmmchickeckmushroomonionquiche. Buttery, savory, chicken-ey... delicious, and a very generous slice at that. Accompanied by a muffin and a garden salad, this really hit my comfort spot. The person I went with had the pecan-encrusted chicken, which I eyed jealously due to the amazing aromas that were wafting over to my side of the table. I'm determined to try that next when I go back. We split a piece of tollhouse pie with vanilla icecream, and here was my only disappointment. The icecream was great, but the pie was overcooked and crunchy/stale where it should have been chewy-gooey.   SERVICE: I like'em spunky, and that's what we got. Casual conversation and laughter was abound, with our food also brought out in a timely manner. Booyah.   ATMOSPHERE: Homey diner, with the high-backed wooden booth benches, and the stools at the soda bar. Like someone took a soda shop from the 40's and mashed it together with hipster culture. I know how that may sound, but trust me when I say it was a success.  PRICE: Average, but the food is above average for the price, in my opinion.  Overall: Pikes has been branded my homesick hub. Whenever I dream of Maine, I'll come here, pull up onnah stool, and get meh a hot turkey sammich, yessah.

Xap_xnnCAhEJg0KwXGm6ZQ.text: Really cool place to have brunch, but the food wasn't much more then par. Very cool decorations and the feel is very relaxed and comfortable to hang out on a Sunday morning with friends. When u pay $14 for a buffet, I would think it would be continually stocked, but they couldn't keep up with the demand. If I went on Sunday in the future, I would go before 10:00 so I could get the cheaper price. My wife ordered off the menu and I think I would do the same next time if I didn't do the buffet.  One of the biggest pluses...if you like potatoe casserole, this I'd the place for you...awesome cheese covered potatoes...Yum! All in all... So-So

_5GxbG1dqmfR2MsYUobawg.text: Finally decided to pay a visit here after taking the kids to Freedom Park - I've seen Pike's from the light rail and always wondered what it was like.   Decor-wise it's a funky mix of old fashioned soda shop (complete with wooden floorboards) mixed with gentrified warehouse chic (complete with exposed girders). The outdoor patio looks really inviting and mellow, especially considering the location (busy corner in the South End).   The menu has a plethora of diner/soda shop standards, notably burgers, sandwiches, and comfort food like fried chicken and meatloaf. The kids ordered the hot dog and grilled cheese kids meals, along with the upgraded milk shakes (of course!). Based on the advice from our server I ordered the Carolina Classic burger - you guessed it, 1/2 pd patty with chili, coleslaw, mustard and onions. Asked for their house chips on the side.   Some observations:  1. The kids meals are impressive in both their size and quality - the hot dog was a kosher beef one, grilled perfectly. Came with two sides, fresh fruit and the house made chips. The grilled cheese was also high quality and overflowing with gooey monterey jack. For the extra $1, the small milkshakes are a steal!  2. The house made potato chips rock -perfectly fried and salted. Completely addictive. They should really create some sort of nacho dish with these. . .if you ladle their house made chili and sprinkle some cheddar on top you would have a heavenly appetizer.  3. While the burger was very good (cooked on a griddle, which I prefer) the chili was stupendous! Meaty, complex, thick - perfect for a burger and made me want to scoop up the leftovers with the chips!   Service-wise, no complaints - prompt, friendly and honest.   Overall this was a great experience and I recommend it to anyone in the Dilworth/South End/Uptown area. Great option if you are at Freedom Park or Nascar Hall of Fame and want a comfortable place for you and the family.

f6Pngs1W42stsDnYQTKGUg.text: Told the waitress we had a meeting to go to down the street, and were in quite a hurry. She said it wouldn't be a problem.  It then took about 20 minutes to get drinks, about 45 min to an hour for the food (which was wrong, but we didnt have time to get a new one), and about an hour and a half before we saw the waitress again to ask for a reciept. We were so insanely late to the meeting we missed the entire thing.   Worst service I've ever had in Charlotte, not to mention the fact we specifically told the waitress we were in a hurry, and she said it wouldn't be any inconvenience.  Went back about a year later, and the service was still ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE!!!!   Will never, ever, ever, go back here. Even though they do have good milkshakes.

cfcdxupF4wXiURbL3GlwvQ.text: Pikes is an old childhood favorite . My dad would always take me here for a banana split and a homemade orangeade. Every time I come into town I always have to stop in and get their pecan chicken with broccoli casserole . That is a plate of pure heaven.

2qcCdDcO4dkBmeEHEwLtUA.text: The best service, the best homemade sodas (cherry Pepsi!), the best food, the best desert (Tollhouse cookie pie!) & such a fun history. Great hole-in-the-wall that I'll be sure to take any Charlotte visitors to! Who doesn't love sodas in glass bottles, old school decor & a fun (True) story of how it all came to be?

VfHGjLMgGxVa_TJ6cvMflg.text: The prices at this place are OUTRAGEOUS ! ! !  We just walked are we took a look at the prices.

Lyg6Fxa0FalMFEGvInOA8g.text: Pike's is what Charlotte is all about. Delicious food, history and a prime location. This converted pharmacy overlooks the light rail in Southend. Sit outside and enjoy the view. There is plenty of street parking and a lot half a block away. Join them for Snday brunch. $13 is a steal for all you get. Magnificent desserts,  a carving station, traditional breakfast items (to die for hash brown casserole) and Southern favorite entree and side options. Plus soup, fruit and those amazing milkshakes. Ok the milkshake is not included in the brunch price but they are still superb and huge. I also noticed how well priced their cocktails were $4-6. Something worth thinking about for my next visit.

523hd9dUv1l0KCYiHZAHtQ.text: Had the Sunday brunch and it was pure comfort food. We had 5-10 mins of waiting time to get to table but it was justified with the variety and quality of food. Really enjoyed our meal and would definitely go back there.

a9BPf4ljc7Y_q9YG4AWNVQ.text: I just cant see myself coming here again.  Parking was tricky, and the wait for a table was long even at 2:00 pm.  Nice waitress, but long wait for food (for every table we saw).  The whole place just seemed unorganized.    My meatloaf sandwich was utterly forgettable, as were the fries.  My son's Mac n cheese was bland.  The star of the table was the Hawaiian chicken sandwich. It was delicious - by any standard.

XZnoSHrxEXgDHUg-ssG-fw.text: I was driving by this curious soda shop one almost rainy day when I decided to stop in and see what it was all about. When I say down at the bar I asked the bar tender to make me his best item.   He came out with a toll house pie. Wow.   I had no idea what I was in for. But man, did I find out. It was a perfectly cooked pie, warmed to taste just like a cookie fresh out of the oven.  It worked... I loved it.

nxDNXXamse8ZqqxqloGcTw.text: Great food & great service! The honey pecan chicken is to die for! The sides are delish. All around great food at reasonable pricing!

MAyFtXmbmWsr68odMFcGEQ.text: It seriously does not get any better than Pike's Soda Shop. Owner, Randy Chitwood, does a great job of capturing the old school diner nostalgia with homemade phosphates and milkshakes as well as a complete southern comfort menu. Everything from Honey Pecan Fried Chicken to Homemade Lasagna is offered weekly. Everything from the french fries to the mac & cheese is made-to-order and is quality all the way. Pike's offers monthly Milkshakes and through the summer it's PEACH all the way. For an awesome step back in time experience, Pike's is where it's at!

jgvwPkFkfikVfLhzWJH1BA.text: Their Sunday brunch was fantastic!  Great food and tons of options, everything from french toast to prime rib.  Staff was quick and friendly.

WjnJxLidfgcdj3fgk-lzoA.text: We love to eat here.  They have great comfort food.  I think there burgers are fantastic!  I always get a burger, but my company usually gets different menu items and always compliments their food.  Coll antique atmosphere.

xgPoBU16YaRf6Y-mCCzX4A.text: Food was good but the server and service were terrible. Server didn't bring anything we requested as she was clueless as to their menu and the area. Don't think we will return.

R7hKQYq3P5XEdSts8tdXpw.text: Met my aunt for her birthday. I had to get the honey fried chicken because that just sounded so darn good. Though the frying batter lacked any spice, it was very crispy which made up for that. Plus how much spice do you need with HONEY? The chicken itself was moist and very tender. As for sides I got the broccoli casserole that was very good, and mashed potatoes. I finished with a chocolate malt which was amazing, even better than Cook Out's and I love those.

kW84RSZb4Wy_hiwPDNLxTQ.text: Pike's is a great casual spot with a lot of Charlotte history. It's the perfect spot to grab a delicious southern style lunch, yummy dessert, or the brunch buffet with a huge selection. Come early on a Sunday for brunch before the church crowd arrives and you can find a seat easier. The food is great and reasonably priced. My favorites are the vegetable plate for lunch (don't miss out on the delicious casseroles) or the blueberry french toast at brunch (and all of the yummy desserts).

B7BNXewrWxPILWmQ3c6nFA.text: Super nice servers and staff.  My food has always been good.  Great grilled pimiento cheese!  Ice cream is sooooo yummy.  If you go for brunch though the buffet looks dirty.  I recommend lunch during the week.

W0HQLxu73UVWfdcZLGsd1w.text: Always good food here great service normally very busy restaurant also another place with not great parking it's worth the stop getting off the train and eating there before you going to uptown just make sure you go during off-peak hours the way can get pretty bad there.

C2WPl_4aER5ybTK8eqwn4w.text: I've come here twice and got awful service each time. I came here today when it wasn't busy and was acknowledged by the host. I sat at the bar for 10 minutes, waiting for someone to come by and take my order. I only wanted a milkshake. There were three employees behind me chatting about "work drama" while other employees were busy working. Not sure why the service is so bad here it seems like they have enough people. If I could give this 0 stars I would.

vYdITspeHXl7SPKb0aMBKA.text: After an unsuccessful Yelper excursion attempt to Pike's for late night desserts, I decided to stop by for lunch today instead.   The atmosphere is interesting. It's casual and quaint, but set in a somewhat industrial styled brick building. Picture old wooden booths with coat hooks and large gilded mirrors set against a ceiling of exposed air ducts and dropped track lighting.   We were greeted warmly at the door, guided to our table quickly and our orders were taken promptly.   Their menu selection features traditional American favorites, some with Southern twists. Choose your own fixin's style burgers, meatloaf sandwiches, chicken tenders are just some of the selections. Their "made from scratch" soups caught my eye, but today's selection was potato bacon and sounded a little too heavy for my tastes.   Our food was delivered within a reasonable time frame. My cheeseburger was good, somewhere between the mark of Five Guys and Penguin's. Fries were crisp, without the taste of old frying oil (my pet peeve). My husband's turkey burger was pretty tasty, seasoned with plenty of flavored seasoning salt.   We finished lunch with the Tollhouse Pie, a chocolate chip cookie baked in a pie crust, topped with vanilla ice cream and fudge. It tasted just as I hoped. Warm, chocolaty, rich, but balanced by the ice cream - an American classic.   My one criticism would be the restrooms which are in dire need of remodeling. I shudder if the old adage of judging a restaurant by their bathroom is really True. At any rate, the dining room atmosphere, food and dessert were all enjoyable.

HYo2kRcf1mBDS6IpeRmrIw.text: The food was pretty good on the Sunday brunch buffet spread.  Our waitress was wonderful and sweet.  The price was great!  Unfortunately, the manager at the front made us feel so unwelcome when we walked in that we will never be going back.

Q_BEJHevVNyMJLZy-rbtPQ.text: Went to the Sunday brunch buffet and it was awful. All out of scrambled eggs and took 30 minutes to get more. Eggs Benedict were cold, hashbrown casserole disgusting, there was one wait staff running around. Terrible, won't be going back here.

bl1O2WRCJg94uce-PwpDSw.text: Arrived on a busy Saturday night, was still able to be sat quick.  Took awhile to get service. Turns out owner randy jumped into action to help out weeded staff.  He took my order sharing his recommendations.  I ordered bison burger. Mac and cheese. Sweet potato casserole.  Came out perfect and tasty.  Then has toll house pecan pie with vanilla bean ice cream.  Then randy had me try a vanilla Pepsi mixed a soda bar and a vanilla ice cream and pure root beer syrup.  Yum.  The whole experience was great.  I reccomend

NxUGR3hIlR81Sb_blrwR2Q.text: I was so excited to eat here, a friend had insisted I come try the bread pudding. After several minutes of indecisiveness I decided to try something out of my norm and ordered a tuna melt. It was okay, it wasn't bad but they put a lot of produce in the salad that I don't particularly care for. But as I sit eating the sandwich I didn't really like another family sat next to me. The same server that was taking care of me very excitedly exclaims to them "oh I love newbies, let me show you some things on the menu. People come from all over for this item". Um, excuse me I'm a newbie too and maybe if I had received that type of attention perhaps I would have actually ordered something I would enjoy.

urhtG2qhVv-SqLUI0dyf2Q.text: Not impressed. The food was fair to poor for the price we paid and our waiter, Geoff, was awful. He smelled drunk, was super sarcastic, and had us waiting for our bill for over 20 minutes after we finished eating even though the restaurant was completely empty. We were so frustrated by the end of our meal. I also tried to go to the restroom but it was so disgusting I decided to hold it. We won't be back.

exenbW5zE59Mf2LVRkOB-Q.text: Really pleasantly surprised with my experience here. Came for dinner last night with my cousins.   The wait staff was super friendly and as you might guess it looks much like an old timey soda shop inside.   My cousin ordered a thin mint milkshake at the beginning of the meal and asked if we could have three straws so my other cousin and I could take a sip. Instead, the waiter brought three cups which was really sweet. I took a tiny little sip - it was delicious.   For dinner I ordered the strawberry salmon salad. It was great. Candied pecans, apples, strawberries, all on a bed of spinach with a very well cooked salmon and strawberry lime vinaigrette on the side.   I thought it was really tasty!   I'll definitely be back!

zfZ6JK_v2HUNuYb7pKkG5A.text: Pike's is a great experience. I am a huge fan of soda flavoring and places like this, and they do not disappoint.  I have had lunch here several times and have enjoyed it each and every time

IA8OdlFP6g24tSsqK_IQWQ.text: My parents took me here for brunch when I was a teenager and I never really appreciated this restaurant. Now that I am older and wiser, Pike's is a GREAT place for a GREAT meal. Now, if a crowded restaurant is any indication of how good a restaurant is, then the crowd at Pike's will tell you that. I had the honey pecan fried chicken and it came with broccoli and seasoned mashed potatoes. It was awesome and tasty. The hint of honey with the pecans was perfect, I ate it all and will be back for more. Parking will be a challenge at lunchtime, so get there before noon, and that should help you to get seated fairly quickly. The prices for lunch are a bit high, but well worth it. Tip your server well, because they work hard at lunchtime.

AYjh_u4UFjMo_yTcYYyCCg.text: I really liked the people at Pikes. They were very friendly and were genuinely glad I came. My friend and I had a nice visit for lunch. She ordered the honey chicken - a boneless fried breast, coated with honey - very tender, with mashed potatoes and green beans. She loved it. I ordered the turkey burger without bun which in many restaurants come out OK. I wasn't so impressed with Pike's. The turkey patty was small and over-seasoned. I'll give it a 2-star. Unfortunately the fries on the side were a 1 - limp and fairly greasy. Yes, I know if you read any of my other reviews, you'll know I'm a fry-snob. These just didn't fill the bill.   My bottom line is, because of the friendly people, I will go back and try some other menu items.

tRZNlGeeUd02-Wx3I_lsoA.text: Very clean old school building with a lot of character. Good variety of drinks and shakes, fresh squeezed selections as well as a great variety of food options. A great place to take the kids or pretend you are a kid all over again.

rotudRSX4226tpBczNLJFw.text: The Sunday brunch is Charlotte's best kept secret.  The food is outstanding.  The bacon is endless. The Benedict is on point. The salads are fresh. The roast beef is SPG perfection. And the lasagna, WOW!!  Check em out.  And don't forget to save room for dessert!!

TINOlZaZxYpu1D8-Fzal8g.text: I came on a Saturday night and I was pleasantly surprised at the excellent customer service. Upon entering I was greeted with a smile and seated.  The waitress soon appeared offering water in presenting the top selections and recommendations. She was patient. The food was good.  I had the bacon burger with the regular fries. They were able to mix the shakes so I had the chocolate peanut butter. The donning experience was pleasant the waitress was very attentive to meeting the needs of my table or party.  The restrooms were clean and so was the restaurant. Overall I recommend and will return.

PWqFsbYh2e83HIbZZJdZDg.text: Was there today for lunch. We were only planning on grabbing some desserts but when we saw the menu, we decided to try out their food.  Only giving three stars because even tho the food was good, the service was just meh.  1. My husband ordered American classic burger with fries. Really good and meat was really tasty.   2. After debating whether to go with pot roast or honey pecan friend chicken, I ordered the latter. My mind was blown away. This was cooked to perfection. I shared it with my 3 year old and he just kept eating it. The broccoli casserole was really good ,too.   3. We weren't asked if we wanted anything to drink and were brought water, which was fine. Half way through our meal, my husband asked if he can have root beer, server totally forgot about it. Oh well.   4. Banana split dessert was good. Nothing fancy just your average banana split. But my cravings were satisfied.   5. Service was meh. This was our first time here and even tho the food was good I don't think we will be back for a while. I feel like we we're rushed from eating.  I was finishing the dessert with my kid and server took the plate away. Even grabbed the check tray as soon as my husband signed it. Idk if he was trying to get off his shift  but whatever. It made our dining experience lack lustre.

qCCs-LAS8pdvAu8_es90rg.text: We stopped in for lunch. My husband and I split the club sandwich and fries. I ordered a bottle of cream soda to go with it. After the sandwich I ordered a hot fudge sundae with chocolate ice cream. It was amazing! The server brought us our bill without even asking if we wanted anything for dessert, which I didn't think was right. Especially since we did want to order ice cream. This restaurant was really such a cute place though.

RgxcQntH1uv5fEeKewsCoQ.text: I stopped in for ice cream to go. One of the best mint chocolate chip ice creams I have ever tasted! The mint flavor was not too overpowering, sometimes it can taste like toothpaste, but not here. I also liked that the ice cream was not too heavy.  And a great value... I got two big scoops of ice cream for $3.79.  The environment is retro cool... You order ice cream at an old-fashioned soda shop counter.  You can sit down and have a full meal, but I did not order any food.  I will definitely return here the next time I travel on business.

QNDWuoOpZRjzkptCENG8tA.text: Pike's never disappoints. My most recent visit was for lunch - meatloaf and mashed potatoes and gravy was so good!!  It was such a large portion that I brought some home. It was supposed to be my lunch the next day - but my husband found it.  Guess I'll have to go back for more!

D5mmaEysd5wFTorEfccyFg.text: I admit I haven't ventured out much to try anything else on the menu other than Sunday brunch. I guess I'm a creature of habit, it it ain't broke don't fix it lol. I'm literally addicted to the honey pecan chicken, broccoli casserole and sweet potato casserole. It's always so delish, fresh and hot. Have never had a bad experience with it. Only reason why I deducted one star is because my nephew was with me and he ordered the shrimp and grits. Although delish and he really enjoyed it, he was not pleased at the amount of grits to sauce ratio. The bowl wasn't very deep so for the price it just seemed to not be enough for what they were charging. Most places I have had shrimp and grits from came in a deep bowl so you could get your money's worth. Other than that a great experience with delish food and a friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

qobol3aNAiZualj3oIShUg.text: A server came in late and they were yelling at him in front of customers. Food came out cold. Overall terrible experience.

z809kpqUMr0mjxWCSYi8ng.text: Perhaps this isn't my first time on this Earth? This was my first visit to Pike's and I loved it. It's not that the food was the best thing that ever happened to me. It's that the food was a solid 8/10. My waiter was an 11/10. The music was a 10/10. The weather the day I visited was a 10/10 (72 in January). Everyone who walked by and worked there smiled and spoke. My overall experience was wonderful.   My waiter, and I forget his name. He was a very handsome, well built, young thang. He had a great sense of humor. Actually joked with us the whole time and was funny. Not corny, not annoying, legitimate not trying too hard made me laugh funny. You can tell he has a good personality 24/7 and I'm not saying that because he was cute. He even told me I was the slowest eater he ever saw. It's True. Management also walked by and asked if everything was okay. He was genuinely friendly. I loved everyone here.  My friend and I ordered the honey pecan fried chicken, which came with broccoli casserole and mashed potatoes. I subbed my mashed potatoes for sweet potato casserole at no additional cost (Yay!). We also shared spinach dip. The dip was creamy with lots of spinach. We ate every single bite of it. The chips were fresh. Not sure if they cook them in house, but they at least warm them up. Also noteworthy is the price point here is really good. $11/ meal.  The chicken was divine. I was a bit nauseous that day, and still couldn't stop eating. The chicken was cooked perfectly and a bit juicy without being drown in honey. The pecans were not cooked,which I think would've enhanced the flavor. I'm definitely going back and getting the exact same meal. Pike's is going to become one of my regular spots to visit.

Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ice cream flavors
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Milkshakes

rMzLg6HGY2hsJW22qgadKg.text: We were out in the South End at some breweries and decided to stop for dessert here.  Everything we had was delicious and the waitress was so nice! They have real root beer (or coke) floats and their pies were hand made in the store.  We were glad we stopped in!

oq8YyjKPossyrU8nwTmrSw.text: Great place to bring your kids and have an amazing atmosphere.  Food is great and shakes and ice cream are as well. Service is always spot on.

ZeZkt9O1bDIiG5IKARkFXQ.text: Pike's Soda Shop is as good as it gets! The 1960's diner atmosphere feels so realistic and the service is great! This family friendly restaurant has amazing burgers and fries, interesting and yummy old fashion sodas, and the best milkshakes I've ever had! You can mix and match varieties of flavors from chocolate to mango! Kid friendly, AMAZING food, great service, and nice atmosphere- it certainly meets all of my best restaurant ever standards! :)

mQXxvanQsyZ5rjP0Mpxpdg.text: Today, we went to Pike's for the first time and was not impressed.  I ordered a tuna melt but before that I did ask the waitress if the tuna was white.  She assured me that it was.  Well it was not!  If you like dark brown tuna then go ahead and order it.  If you don't, then don't.  The chef should know better than to serve that.  It was very unappetizing and disappointing.  We will not be going back anytime soon.

O1bKLLJCQfull2zr_1f3Ug.text: Love the pot roast and the honey pecan chicken. The toll House cookie bar with ice cream will make you pop it is so full and rich and delicious.

5wPPlNt91zv08TpTYCrjew.text: My husband and I actually stumbled upon this place by chance, we were just driving around Charlotte on our last day of our visit and thought this place looked interesting.  It was a Sunday and beautiful out, so it was perfect place to grab some brunch and enjoy the weather.  The service was great, our waiter was super attentive, and we got seated right away.  The brunch buffet looked great, but was definitely a little pricey as others have mentioned.  I wasn't super hungry, so I opted for the quiche (which was good but not amazing).  My husband got the buffet and I kind of felt like there wasn't a lot of stand out options that would merit the $13 price.  Overall I really liked the feel of it and had a good experience, just wish the price wasn't so high or there were more reasonable options.

hgUg1WfooGoyMu8TCbsKIA.text: It was ok, the sweet potato casserole was good but as a whole still just ok. We ordered fish tacos(which is supposed to come with guacamole) only for us to get them and then told afterwards they were out of guacamole..

ov--qP8DZ24aSkrR0NxpvQ.text: Had not been to Pikes in over a year, so we decided to go for dinner.  Our waiter was prompt and friendly.  He said he could not make food recommendations as he  had only been on the job three weeks.  We appreciated his honesty. The flounder was on special , so we gave it a try.  The fish was okay, but  nothing spectacular.  My fries had way too much black pepper on them.  Why only three stars?  The hostess, the first face you see, was sulllen, her greeting was non existent.  She is a definite downer to the Pike's experience

mAyGwHbQRHTL6ZiCfVluEQ.text: Great brunch!  Phenomenal desserts!    A Charlotte staple not to be missed!

kNoaFq9DoN9WgL3EiT31ug.text: Well me and a group of 9 of my girlfriends started my birthday outing here for lunch and nobody enjoyed their food. My friend  and I had a Greek salad with salmon and it was on a bed of iceberg lettuce and the salmon was very dry. It was not good at all. My other friend ordered the quiche, which came with a brand muffin and a salad. Well she finally got the salad after she was finished eating and I reminded the waitress that she never got it. Another friend asked for a water and finally got it right before we got ready to leave and we had asked for it over and over. Our waitress seemed very flustered. We had to keep asking for the condiments and the dressing that came with our salads. She was so bad one of the girls sked the manager if she was new. It was a horrible way to start my day. Needless to say we will not be going back. The only good thing was the oreo milkshake one of the girls got, she said it was delicious!

vRlMsFoIoRNwr-0nZzTpGQ.text: I like Pike's!  I stopped in for brunch today after passing the shop multiple times every time I ride LYNX into the city.  I arrived just after 10:00 and had no problem finding a parking spot as things were pretty quiet.  I was seated quickly and greeted just as quickly by my waiter, Justin.  I chose the buffet which had the advantage of staring me down as soon as I walked in the front door.  The breakfast side of the buffet runs the entire front portion of the front counter, with the lunch side along the wall on the right.  The food was good, with the only strike being the hash browns, which were more like a hashbrown casserole (a la Cracker Barrel).  The service was fantastic.  Justin was on top of things throughout the meal.  Plates were removed quickly and my water was refilled in a very timely manner.  The price jumps $5.00 after 10:00am and I'm not certain if it's worth it.  The breakfast portion is definitely worth it, and next time I'll make it a point to stop by earlier.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunch Menu - 08/11

x5xNLRye8XyHUvlJcGQbhA.text: Driving through and wanted a place that served food and ice cream. This place was amazing! Super cute outdoor seating perfect for warm days. Staff was very friendly! Food was amazing! Totally recommend the BBQ pizza flatbread and the Hawaiian pineapple chicken sandwich! Would totally come back!

jNRbZ-38M0aoi_mUKjzTaw.text: I have not had a good experience here in years... even after numerous attempts at giving them the benefit of the doubt.. Meatloaf is bad and almost tasteless, Turkey Burger came out with frozen chunks in it, the pralines and cream milkshake came out and had lemon seeds in it for some reason.. just bad. Everything tastes like it was frozen and store bought. Not going back. Milk shake wasn't bad aside from the rogue lemon seeds..   I feel like the owner should watch Kitchen Impossible a few times.. they have a great location, look and brand.  It has so much potential; please serve fresh food with flavor.

SHzu7dcBT_XFfN7UCHQUAQ.text: I've been to Pike's a few times, and I've really enjoyed it! My favorite thing on the menu is the roasted turkey with stuffing. It's like reliving Thanksgiving dinner all over again. The dinner comes with mashed potatoes, the vegetable of the day and a roll. At a price of about $11, that's not a bad deal.   I've also stopped by just for an ice cream sundae, and that was delicious. The soda shop is very cute inside and is located in the trendy South End neighborhood. It's worth visiting if you're looking for some tasty American food and dessert.

pVXAmlT75PQJgFSj4VLXeg.text: Enjoyed lunch at this long time Queen City establishment. The service was excellent, the lunch portions the right size and the price very reasonable. Great place to enjoy a quick lunch with daily specials that you won't find at many other places.

3cP9V27DqZWe1rv57cUYCQ.text: I stopped in for a quick sandwich and loved the atmosphere. The decor reminded me of the old drugstores. They even offer Saranac Shirley Temples in a bottle. I found the staff was warm and friendly, too.  For my meal, I ordered the special: Corned Beef Reuben, with a side of fruit. I also ordered a cup of tomato bisque. I was served the bisque first and I enjoyed the thick consistency of the soup. The reuben came out hot and tasted good. While I enjoyed the thin amount of dressing, I would have liked a bit more beef. The fruit was decent, too. For dessert, I ordered the gooey pumpkin bread served warm with whipped cream. Delicious!  I enjoyed my meal at Pike's and it's worth the few extra dollars to enjoy the old-fashioned antiques and atmosphere.

gz2wspnWX4XEliVgcOZibw.text: Had the Sunday brunch buffet with my wife, I really liked the comfort food and the service was great as well, will be back for sure.

_vSm3vjF49sj7c6JHvW7Mw.text: The buffet has a little bit of everything. My most favorite is the western omelet with the hashbrown casserole (I think that's the name of it..) Friendly atmosphere and waitstaff.

UC1W1oxAZglKZUlFR4otYQ.text: The host had an attitude and the bathrooms and dining area stunk. The vegetable plate and service from our waitress was very good but that was overshadowed by the hosts attitude and the smell of sewage in the bathrooms. They had a bucket under the sink to catch a leak. This place needs a facelift and energy infusion. Only 3 tables were sitting for dinner last week and this was at 6pm and not a Monday.

3YFzt6OpvOpZzimg2FrNFg.text: Popped into Pike's before the Thursday Night Saints Panthers game bc it was far enough away from the stadium to not be crowded. What I found was a great atmosphere and reasonably priced top notch food. My chicken breast was delicious and my dads said the chicken pot pie special was the best he's ever eaten. Will be a regular stop for me from now on.

Ssr8drvg0RaENSOvIWTOXw.text: Sunday brunch is great here but for the price  the selection could've been a bit more. Service is great here as always.

APYKvzSeFxMHzcYwrgiPyA.text: Food was awesome except they forgot to put our appetizer in. Server very slow, we were one of two tables yesterday around 3p. Nostalgic kinda of place, but service wasn't great.

WrR_NbzZZS14lVQWowDdpA.text: Came in for the bathroom for my great aunt, but then decided to get milkshakes. We were acknowledged upon entry and helped as soon as she finished working with another family. We ordered Oreo, strawberry, chocolate and pineapple milkshakes with isn't on the menu but the waitress was like we can make whatever you want. That my type of service!!   Milkshakes were good especially for a warm day and the service was excellent.

94MlDDfaMmnwLISQ84fiIw.text: None of the food is worth it and the service was terrible.   Vanilla Bean Shake- decent shake  Fish taco- not the best or the worst. Wouldn't ever get them again. -kgvw_4h0C5N2ClNsSEEOg.text: Stopped in for lunch today with some friends. It was raining and we all had umbrellas. The hostess offered to bring us an umbrella stand so we could leave our wet umbrellas by the front door.   I ordered a 1/2 lb cheeseburger with fries ($9.99). My friends ordered the French dip and a grilled chicken salad. And a peanut butter malted milkshake.   My cheeseburger was pretty big, but just ok. There wasn't a lot of flavor. My friends felt the same about their meals. Just ok.  The milkshake surprisingly took a long time to come out. We were almost finished with our meals by the time it arrived, but it was worth the wait. The milkshake was a big hit. I will be back for more milkshakes!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburger and fries

BnQs6UfdvOMJTDswwqhKHg.text: Great location, but that's honestly the only reason we went here for lunch. We just moved to Charlotte and were looking for a place to eat, and since we were getting pretty hungry, we decided to give it a shot.  We basically regretted going here about halfway through our meal. The food is mediocre.. Nothing special. They asked how we wanted our burgers cooked, we said medium, they came out well done. The chips were soggy, and other foods were obviously previously frozen. We could have easily cooked our food better at home, and not have to deal with the slow and unorganized service.  We asked for particular side items and got different ones that we didn't ask for. The waiters were running around frantically, like they obviously needed more help, and it was obvious to us, because they would constantly bring orders out to the wrong tables.  Sorry to say we don't have anything really positive about the restaurant to say, except that the staff was at least nice and it's in a prime location. Definitely would not go again.

RxDKPs6OXCEOCcXR-NIjew.text: I had high expectations for this place, but I left with a mediocre experience. The food was just average and that's the most important part for me when it comes to rating a place. The service and prices were fine, as was the Hawaiian Chicken sandwich I ordered. I just had higher hopes. In all fairness, I didn't get a desert which is what these guys are famous for.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hawaiian Chicken Sandwich just needed a sauce or something. Good but a tad bland

jZpaokKZVS4YGQm-LjUIeQ.text: I came here wanting some classic, yet substantial, comfort food. Our friendly waitress recommended the Honey Pecan Fried Chicken, a Pike's staple, and my craving was satisfied. One of the best comfort food I had in Charlotte was here at Pike's.   As I was looking at the menu, it was clear why people flock to Pike's.  Simply, because of their classic Southern American dishes that cannot be found anywhere else in Charlotte: create your own burger, giant milkshakes, and house-made desserts & sodas, just to name a few.  I loved the fantastic old-school decor with the spinning barstools, and stainless steel furniture. Also, it's pet-friendly which is a plus.  Four and Half Yelps.

ICyKhWaFwQoIHSBTSnAsZA.text: CONTINUE to support Pike's. I'll admit, It took me toooo long to get to Pike's. I have been a resident of Charlotte for 5+ years and have heard about his nostalgic soda shop. It's cute. Look past the attempts of overshadowing done by surrounding newcomers to the neighborhood and support this gem. Stop in for some classic desserts, the Tollhouse Pie was AMAZING. Continue support Pike's and their staff. Let's keep these doors open.
