3YgRanasHowRE_aNatWATA.text: My family & I came here on a Saturday morning. They were actually not too busy at all. The atmosphere was nice. I liked the historical artifacts & decorations they had there. The staff was friendly. I did see bugs crawling around but I kind of chalked it up to just the door being opened & closed. It put me off slightly but I tried to over look it. The menu is a decent size & they do have a lot of things to choose from. I got the Carolina cheeseburger I think it was called. It was just a plain cheeseburger. Nothing special but it was very very good. I will say that. I got the Mac & cheese as my side & well.... that wasn't so good. I didn't like the macaroni at all. It had a very weird taste & consistency. Our waitress was nice but you could tell she'd just started & didn't know too much about the menu. Overall, the place was just ok. I don't think it's somewhere I would frequent though.

KbcJ-YvzhgcUJHxrYet83w.text: Pike's is amazing! I got a grilled cheese with pimento cheese, bacon, and jalapeno and it was great. Their burgers are also delicious and large.  Their homemade chips are a must! Their shakes are amazing as i got butter pecan ice cream with oreo and peanut butter!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

wvAARjN9DXtM7WLCeH_JhQ.text: Pike's is amazing! I got a burger with pimento cheese and it was great. The grilled pimento cheese with bacon and jalapeno was also amazing. Their homemade chips are a must! Their shakes are a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

4_fF2PYvpuaZfGEsWzZc0A.text: When I travel to a city that I have never visited before, I look at Groupon. It's a perfect way to save a bit of money, visit restaurants, figure out where they are, and see how yummy the food is. I bought two Groupons. The first one was with Pike's.  The restaurant's description had me at ice cream. Being borderline lactose-intolerant does not stop me from having it.  The funny thing about both restaurants with Groupon promotions is that I had a difficult time opening the main door at both places. Perhaps I was so weak without any food in my stomach that I didn't have the strength. A male staff member helped me out at Pike's.  I came here for lunch. I got seated in a booth. It wasn't all that busy. It did feel like I was in a time warp. I loved the retro feel.  My server was wonderful. I indicated that I had a Groupon. He encouraged me to order as much as I could to maximize my $20 Groupon. I went with the following items:  - French beef dip au jus - Fries with turkey gravy - Diet Pepsi - Bread pudding with caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream  I asked whether I could get gravy with my fries. He asked me whether I wanted beef or turkey gravy. So fancy! Options are wonderful. I went with the latter.  I like that the food portions aren't ridiculously massive. My French beef dip au jus was the perfect size. The beef was tender. The baguette was crusty and tender. The jus wasn't overly salty. It was perfect.  I loved the turkey gravy on the fries. I ate everything on that plate. With the turkey gravy being this delicious, I have a feeling that the beef gravy would have been equally as tasty.  My server was attentive and got me a second Diet Pepsi without my even asking for another. I didn't finish all of it, but I was pretty close.  The bread pudding here is amazing! He asked whether I wanted my scoop of vanilla ice cream to be on top of the bread pudding or on the side. I love how accommodating staff are. I went with the former. The ice cream was creamy and yummy.  In the end, I did well on the how-much-can-you-get-for-twenty-bucks scale. I owed 53 cents! Naturally, I plopped down a decent tip.   I loved it here. I had a relaxing, delicious lunch and visited a different part of Charlotte.  Metered parking is on the street. There was plenty of it when I dropped by after 13:00. The meter accepts credit cards.  (144)

TTQJworEPp4MIVA-VqWHlA.text: This place was super cute and made me feel nostalgic about simplier times! The decor inside is very diner-inspired. Service was good for our 8 people group and we were seared in a few minutes afrer walking in. The food was okay, everyone in my party did not seem to be jumping for joy over the flavors or foods. I will say that the malts we got were very good! Black cherry was just the right consistency and no big chunks of cherries was a plus. The food comes out pretty fast (we actually got our food a few minutes after our appetizers). The server was very kind and spent extra time talking to our group and appeared attentive to our table. Overall, okay experience, nothing spectacular, but I do have plans to give it another shot!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Black cherry malt

D0mzK0b9acsxF_ZK9unokg.text: Cool place.   Far from being an old time soda shop.  True old time soda shops have soda jerkers and soda on tap.   Along with a large selection of sodas and a list of them.    The staff was friendly.    The food was fair to poor.   I had the byob (build your own burger).  I had better at McDonald's.   And it had more flavor then this place.  Wife ordered the (honey fried chicken).  It was a boneless skinless chicken breast filleted and breaded.   Where I come from we call this chicken fried chicken.  All it was missing was the white gravy.  Fries were previously frozen and awful.  The Mac and cheese is boxed, the onion rings were also previously frozen.  And the price for what you get is ridicules.  For the price they charge I expect real made from scratch meals not reheats from us foods.

Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

7rS6tZNKRdZGSuvjHXIMLw.text: We came here for the first time on a Friday night as my boyfriend and I were in the search for a brownie sundae. Apparently not many places in Charlotte offer this delicious treat! The brownie sundae did not disappoint. It consisted of a warm brownie topped with 3 scoops of vanilla bean ice cream, hot fudge, whipped cream and a cherry on top. It was gone within a matter of minutes, without a drop to spare. Our server Paul was upbeat, genuine and knowledgeable. It was a five star dessert experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

BiL2PEcD6k4aSni95P_1Vg.text: Service seemed to be consistently slammed and overwhelmed, but when it comes down to it, Pike's has some pretty good food.  Since I'm on vacation, I get what sounds interesting, and this time I drew from the bottom of the menu and pulled out an Chocolate New York Egg Cream. No, I didn't know what it was, but for those curious, it's 1/2 Yoo Hoo! (only much better tasting) and 1/2 whipped egg whites. Or something that approximates whipped egg whites. It fills the "I want ice cream but not something as heavy as a malt" gap so well that it really ought to be offered in more places.  With it I got Honey Pecan Fried Chicken, with a side of potatoes and broccoli casserole, in a misguided attempt to eat healthier. As it turns out the broccoli casserole has a lot of onions, but even more dairy, and lots of cheese. Delicious, but oops! The potatoes were very well seasoned. The fried chicken is something they're very good at; perfectly crisp at the margins, flattened to a uniform ~1/4" thickness, and holding a pool of honey and toasted pecans in the middle. This was great stuff.  They probably could use another server or two, but on the whole I'd recommend Pike's in a heartbeat.

Hi830nfTPADcKQmitKUN2w.text: OMGEEEEEEE!!!! THIS PLACE IS SOOOOO ADDICTIVE!!! I can't even tell you how much I love the dish I always order the same thing.... I am one of those people once I find what I like I stick to it!! You have to try their food! I want to lick my picture this food is so good!! Check them out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. MAPLE PECAN CRUSTED CHICKEN, AND MASHED POTATOES

AWVoOt8yqVoF7hSOhAA68g.text: Went here before they temp closed to relocate. Soo good! Had a french dip with aus jus. My kids had burgers and rootbeer floats. Can't wait for them to reopen.

XGijzpJcgXj5igXR5X3mtQ.text: Love Pikes Soda shop. It has an old time feel and the food is delicious. The staff is friendly and we always enjoy eating there.

WpIZYeAl9qZz5kMHjUSQ0A.text: The brunch food was fair to very poor.......... The staff was great though - very friendly and attentive. I really wish the food equaled the staff!! Really didn't like the food at all, neither did my wife. Lasagna was dry, almost sauceless and barely warm. The "French toast" wasn't French toast whatsoever, but was a bread pudding thing with blueberries in it. Grits were watery and flavorless. The sweet potato casserole was great though!! I'd like to try their Fried Chicken, but it wasn't on the brunch.  Please, fix the food!!!!

gDFPTOgq1gZ86TfNFQn1vw.text: I bought a Groupon for Pike's that was good for food purchased after 4:00 p.m., so we went on a Thursday evening, around 7:15 p.m.  It was pretty empty. We ordered Chicken and waffles (they were fried chicken tenders), and a baked chicken breast sandwich (with pineapple and bacon) with fries on the side. I had the sandwich and it was good. I liked that it came out steaming hot because I like my food served hot. My husband had the chicken and waffles and he liked it. So, four stars for the food. My only issue was that I thought the restaurant could be a bit cleaner. A table directly next to us sat dirty and while we were eating a little critter visited us on the side of the wall. It wasn't a roach, but since I was feeling like the dining room could do with a bit more thorough cleaning (the floors were a little dirty too), it made me cringe. I had to deduct a star for overall cleanliness. Oh...and they're a bit too pricey. I would only return if there was another Groupon deal and if they did a better job cleaning up the dining area.

XwT8Al8aYDzhVC9MlCRSbQ.text: This has to be one of the best hidden gems that Charlotte has to offer! I have been coming to Pike's for years with friends, family and even co-workers. The atmosphere is upbeat, the wait staff is always eager to help and the food is always top notch! Beware, if you eat a full meal you may not have room for their amazing deserts! I have not had an item on their menu I would not order again. With Pike's, you simply can not go wrong!

U8cg-T0CQb7VBK452ljt0g.text: I love this place. Friends of ours recommended this spot when they stumbled upon it during the DNC weekend. Sadly we waited until tonight to give it a try. Big mistake on our part...(for waiting so long to try it).  We were entertaining out of town family and wanted to give them a taste of Charlotte. Ironically we were at the "taste of Charlotte" event earlier in the day. But I digress.   We walk into Pikes for dinner and it really does have that old school soda shop/diner vibe. The menu has some great home style dishes and typical southern appetizers, along with plenty of options for milkshakes, malts and floats.  I had the pecan fried chicken. It was atop the entrees listed on the menu. I love pecans. I love fried chicken. It was a great combination. It was delicious and a good sized portion. It came with mashed potatoes and broccoli casserole. I subbed in fries.   I also had a fresh orangeade and for dessert a root beer flavored milkshake. I was very impressed and can't wait to go back. The service was good and the prices were very reasonable. They also have daily specials and brunch on Sundays, both of which were very intriguing.   It's a fun and casual place and very reasonably priced. I look forward to my next visit and definitely recommend for folks to give it a try.

5_-GlQTviIQ_jf97OjhfoQ.text: Awesome ice cream float and service! Extremely attentive and friendly staff.  And i was only visiting, thanks Pike's, from Tampa Bay!

B6prN8nB-x3ldDd_wtP_IA.text: I would give the Charlotte location more stars but I'm a customer big on customer  service and I don't like bad service. I work in the area so we ordered often. I especially like the turkey burger because of the size but it was really small today. I told the cashier I wasn't happy and she had an attitude and she called the manager like...."dude come tell this chick it's the same ounces every burger" and the manager agreed with her but offered to make me another. so I had to sit there while she's venting to another  manager in front of me on what happened and her body language, the neck rolling, and the new manager looking at me made feel like she had a problem with me not being satisfied so I asked the manager if she is ok and is it a problem that I'm not happy and she said no but I said it seems like it and she said no she's just going through alot. my new burger came out and they're all standing around to see my reaction to the same  small burger. I told them thanks and left. I threw it away. well there goes almost 13 dollars. my clients or the stylists that came every week will not be going here anymore.  if you complain, it doesn't matter that your the customer because if the cashier is having a bad day......thats more important than customer service......terrible. signed a once happy customer but so upset with the professionalism and how customers don't matter

nwySivrJoD9i5NcZpegDEg.text: Equal parts old-fashioned soda shop, restaurant, bar, and hangout. The location is absolutely crucial here. Located in one of the more walkable parts of South End, Pike's is a gem with a hefty menu complete with plenty of sweets and southern treats.  Haven't been to Pike's in quite some time and this was my first go for lunch. Decided to dine al fresco and enjoyed every second of it. This time 'round, didn't go for anything on the sweet side of things, but rather went for the lunch menu solely.   Started with the mozzarella sticks. Both myself and my dining counterpart were shocked that they weren't the "out of the bag" variety. These appeared to be hand breaded with a higher quality cheese than typically served. Marinara was standard, but the mozz sticks themselves were great. They also weren't covered with the typical panko, moon dust, crappy breading like usual.  Went with the buffalo chicken sandwich for my entree. Holy craaaaaap. Ditch the bun, eat a few of the house-made chips, and enjoy the chicken. Not only is this sucker lightly breaded and flavored well with the buffalo sauce, it's straight up baptized in the sauce. Swimming, rather. I'm usually not for a pool of sauce, but this stuff was fantastic. It acted as a nice residual dipping sauce for the remaining chips.   Service was friendly, outside was perfect for the present weather, prices are fair, walkability is always a plus. Find a parking space along Camden or near Atherton and you're good to go.

ZNyGd2c1RQwTokygMHRLvA.text: The management totally ignored our reservation and basically told us we were not as important as walk ins. We had a party of 12 and we confirmed our reservation. Totally ridiculous. Will not be back.

QP_tA4wVAuKHLWwMvuqXAg.text: Been here a few times and each time I wonder why I even come back. The brunch buffet is fine, if there's food ready. This most recent visit I opened 3 cooking tins and all empty and just had to wait. Not a big selection either. I realized after eating it's not worth the price, the wait, or to go in general. Orangeade is bomb though, but probably won't return.

VilXamsF5MvuZz6FWuf6eQ.text: Awesome atmosphere and great desserts. We enjoyed a brownie sundae a chocolate milkshake a frappacino milkshake and they were all great. Especially the frappacino milkshake. Good location too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

FfE0BUDPxcWfxx0In4DNjg.text: Terrible service- waited over 5 minutes at our table. No one ever spoke to us-/. Terrible service- left and went to big bens

Gd6SS7JhOkE5e1dgp0SQbw.text: I was looking for a different place to check out in South End and thanks to my trusty Yelp app, came across Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop.  I love vintage things and I love ice cream, so it seemed like a logical thing to come check this place out!  This place gets more kudos for it's fun, light, family oriented atmosphere and its vintage look.  I love how it feels like you stepped into a different time when you walk in.  The servers were really friendly and cheerful and everyone around seemed to be having a good time.  The food, unfortunately, is just OK.  Nothing special - your typical diner like food and even their milkshakes were tasty, but not anything I haven't already had before.  I did enjoy myself there, however, so would come back again if I were in the neighborhood, but unfortunately, won't likely be one of my regular spots for grub.

9kPddq1ANMOfZkc2rpcBEw.text: Wow!!!! Rolled in to here by mistake but so glad I did. Hot dogs were so good. I will say I was somewhat put off by the individual pricing for onions and chilli for the $4.99 All Beef hot dog but just decid3d to scale down my toppings.  The hot dog platter came with some awesome cut fries with just the right amount of seasonings. This restaurant really is a True soda shop. I could see my self in her a lot if I fall off of my diwt. Ice Cream and desserts were available plus root beer floats. Please try it out.

2IdQxzM0_I0eoDfT8dokwA.text: I have not been to Pike's in a long time.  I had the day off so I decided to take the rail and have some lunch and a delicious milkshake before heading downtown for some sightseeing. Wow, was Pike's a disappointment!  Rather than having a milkshake they served me chocolate milk - literally. There wasn't any ice cream in that milkshake. I asked my server about it and this was his story....this is how they make them. If you want it thick you need to request it. I'll just go to Chick-fil-A or Dairy Queen instead!  They know how to make a good, normal milkshake!  Sorry Pike's....you need to return to your roots from the days when you were located on Shamrock Drive!

-TYYpqoo4i5psigyjqob5Q.text: I went here for brunch with friends. We we're seated outside and it was lovely out. The brunch buffet options were alright. I got a burger but they don't have fries on Sunday , fryers are turned off. Our service was slow...slow...slow. Very poor service and they were not that busy. The service is the reason why we will not be back. It took to long to get checks, food, and drinks.

yobWTWqDlMzEXr4o00HOgw.text: I actually went here twice this past weekend while my parents were in town. We first popped in for dinner and then again for the breakfast buffet. It's worth mentioning that there is actually a breakfast and a brunch buffet with varied times, a bit of a varied menu and a few dollars more for brunch.  In order of how much I appreciated each, I would say the wait-staff deserves the gold, the atmosphere and decor the silver and the food gets the bronze. Now, the same way I wouldn't complain about a bronze medal I really can't complain about the food. However, I truly can't rave about it. So much so that I needed to knock two stars off.  What Pike's has effectively proven to be for me is a close-by place to grab a good meal at a good price without much hassle. Nothing stands out and I'm never craving it but a good stand-by none-the-less.  Disclaimer: This can very well be grounds for an updated review in the coming weeks but the most I've experienced in way of desserts here is a SIP of a milkshake. The cakes on display look great and a slice of one with a milkshake on the side could nudge me to add a 4th star.

APvcPh3Yp6hO4Mp5mlsg0g.text: Went to grab a festive pre-holiday dinner...after 45 minutes of sitting in booth we were  informed by waitress (who was quite pleasant) that our ticket had been lost. As we were under time constraints we were hesitant to still get food so she went to get manager to see what he could do...When he came out he seemed inconvenienced and then seemed shocked-even after we explained our time crunch- that we no longer wanted our food. I probably would have gotten it to go but his attitude and demeanor made us walk out promptly. I've worked in food industry and they were not in dreaded "weeds" as there were no more than 7 tops in whole establishment. I will never go back due to this manager and his unprofessional attitude...shame as it seemed like a nice diner and the waitress really was accomodating.

hXrQuhgyywqs6taiSvKw5Q.text: I am very disappointed in the restaurant owner. I emailed two weeks prior to visiting the establishment and asked if they had egg in their bread and ice cream. He replied and stated he had bread with no egg and ice cream.  When we reached the restaurant I decided to check in with the waitress again. She returned and stated all the bread had egg. When I told her I emailed and showed her his response she stated he was wrong. Thank god I asked again. If he had eaten the bread we could have had a life threatening situation since he is severe allergic.  I would like to stay that the waitress and cook where amazing and worked very hard to make the meal enjoyable for my nine year old. It appears that the owner doesn't really know what he is serving to his costumes. We will not be returning.

Gqr7HMRogWv4pKpBHfqg_g.text: Meh. While the soda shoppe theme is super cute, the food just fails to deliver. I ordered the pecan fried chicken which was cooked perfectly but WAY too sweet. The sweet potato casserole was too sweet. The limeade was too sweet. The mac & cheese was bland and the burger was boring (luckily both were not sweet...ewww). Service was fine, a little on the slow side but nice. Perhaps the desserts are where its at, but I will be skipping the food from now on.

mwbT7tPug5raE43j27cJKg.text: Most everything about Pike's was phenomenal.  The food was absolutely delicious as was the homemade soda and ice cream.  The service was exceptional and some of the friendliest that I've seen.  As far as seating and atmosphere goes, it was great.  We sat with everyone and could read about the history of the restaurant (which is always fun for me).  If you go you'll learn right away about Pike's being used in the film Shallow Hal.  Pike's is in a beautiful part of Charlotte with easy access.  The only downer is the price.  Just a bit pricey but not too bad. My rating breakdown is as follows: Food-5/5 Price-4/5 Service-5/5 Seating/Atmosphere-5/5  Great job Pike's!  One of my favorites in the Charlotte area.

qNHhm21Iyv0VkVCTsdF-Fw.text: Today my husband and I was driving in the neighborhood and decided to stop for an early lunch. It was his first visit and I have been there several times. Each time I visit,  I always have a wonderful experience from the time we are greeted by the hostess, the waiters, manager and great food; today everything was perfect. Our waiter, Tom was ah-mazing; ask for Tom and he will make sure you have a memorable experience. Great work Pikes, we look forward to visiting again.

w5BmjDeks5z92asS7onYUw.text: can't speak for the normal food. but I'm a chocolate fiend and I have never in my life had a better hot fudge brownie sundae.

IW-1HCTh-V0CzXe_TfmXFg.text: Best brunch buffet in town. Service and variety are great. Try to get there before 10am on Sundays because the price skyrockets after 10 for little more than roast beef and green bean casserole. That's why I give it 4 instead of 5.

M1zx5CNSFcRv1fMKo52cfg.text: Awesome breakfast buffet!  Great selection of all the best breakfast/brunch favorites.  Not to mention Fantastic cupcakes and desserts, too :)  Perfect outdoor patio for Sunday morning brunch and right off the blue line train.

eGMLHNUoIrEQuoz-Khg4aA.text: The only complaint I have with Pike's is they moved their main Soda Shop from my neighborhood!  I live a few blocks from Pike's Pharmacy and the original Soda Shop was next to it.  Then they went "yuppy" and closed that one down.  There is another restaurant in there now.  I guess the old neighborhood wasn't good enough for them!

8cad069J-ci4a1hShpi5GA.text: Growing up in the Deep South, I think I got to go to one soda shop as a VERY small child before they completely disappeared. When we moved up here in 2002, I discovered Pike's a few months after getting here and  was hooked  by the Soda Shop sign- my mom grew up in the days when they were the norm.  I appreciate the consistency of the care given by the owner and the staff to their customers and I don't  think I have ever had a bad meal there.  We drive in from University City about twice a month and I know the daily specials by heart- Fish Friday is good ( very nice roumalade sauce!) and the pork tenderloin on Thursday is very nice as is the Mac and Cheese.  If you have good sweet tea, which they do, you are already half way to my heart.  On the special inserts, the owner has a message to take on the bottom of the page and I can honestly say the management abides by it. It goes something like "Recycle even when it is inconvenient, tip lavishly, do something nice for a stranger..."etc.  I appreciate people who honestly seem to give a care about  your repeat business and now, almost 8 years from the first visit, we still keep going back. Sunday brunch buffet can get very crowded very fast depending on when you venture out, and that was the one thing that I haven't been that impressed with though there are plenty of options. Bottom line, if you like a laid back atmosphere, aren't necessarily in a rush ( though they do try to be prompt) and remember that you are, after all, still in a southern city when it comes to the menu then it should be a nice experience.  Peanut Butter milkshake is usually divine, too, but a smidgen pricey so get it to drink there ( you get more)!!

kByfZsnXP1aJadx6qn5Ziw.text: Went for brunch.  Had an omelette.  Food was good, but just good.  Nothing to write home about.  Atmosphere is cool.

pH7yjTKT_bYR9ZPFnrs3rg.text: Yummy!!! I really do like this place. If you go on Sunday for brunch, their  brunch buffet has a great variety. Their vegetable soup is delicous, they have a lasagna that is sooo good. And their deserts are really amazing. However, when I go during other times. I typically order the honey pecan fried chicken. My goodness, I LOVE it. The chicken is moist, with anice crunch crust. Drizzles in honey and pecans. With a side of their sweet potato and broccoli caserole. They have that southern home cooking down pat. I would definitely advise for you all to go there.

111cKkfiG-BOtgVc0QPdMg.text: I am reviewing this place based on the Sunday brunch. I really like this location and the interior. The staff is always friendly and welcoming. The Sunday brunch price is also very great and I hope that it will not change. However, the food quality is not the greatest. Things just taste bland and not that good. I only liked one or two dishes from the entire brunch buffet. But it has also a great outdoor seating area and inside it is nice and rustic and reminds me a bit of nice brunch places in Berlin, Germany. I will return but hope that the quality of food will increase a bit. The reason I still gave it four out of five stars is that the price might be so low as they are reflecting the quality of the food. I also like that the have a child brunch buffet fee as many places do not consider that.

BDIoq6h_iDYI-L58v1QOFw.text: A great place for lunch or dinner with a diner setting. The staff is exceptional, April was the first to greet me when I moved from TX to NC and she made me feel great about being in Charlotte.   Then food is always prepared fresh, served hot and they offer a variety of diner style cuisine. I would give them 5 stars, but they don't have a full service bar which makes them not a top ranking place for me when it comes to relaxing after work with a cocktail.

i4N4Ew6wC0gFT65BmZootQ.text: True old fashioned soda shop from the moment you walk-in!  Waffle cones come with three scopes of ice cream and the milk shakes are hand made. A little cramped in the outdoor seating, but all in all a great little ice cream place with authentic 1950's soda shop feel.   Go on a cool evening and sit outdoors to enjoy a view of uptown. Great place!

AjEMkM5a5UZt8KNzpZo0lA.text: I'm a fan based on two things:  The price for breakfast and the variety of baked goods offered!  If I read the menu correctly, you have to get there before 10am to get the breakfast price of $8.95 versus the "brunch" price of $13.95.  The buffet was perfect and offered everything I could have wanted so I suggest sticking with the breakfast buffet.  Buffets can go one way or the other.  Either they are disgusting (ie Golden Corrall) with a ton of plastic, boxed food or they are a display of heavenly goodness.  Fortunately for me, Pike's offered the latter!   We're talking fresh fruit salad, biscuits and gravy, grits, cheese/potatoe hash, muffins, scones and pastries, eggs, egg benedict, sausage, bacon, blueberry french toast, etc.  Everything was fresh, what needed to be crispy was crispy, what needed to be fluffy was fluffy, what needed to be moist was moist.  It was all very good and of course the best part is that it is limitless!  The servers were friendly and by around 10:30 it was starting to get packed.  Obviously the south-end location is key and there really shouldn't be any other reason not to give them a try!  I'll be back!

oIFjWjpktOkW_Tk1RxjN_A.text: Stopped by here after spending a few hours in Freedom Park. Nice restaurant, decor, service and the food was really good. We ordered the grilled cheese sandwich which was excellent and came with and order of tasty, hot, crunchy fries. The bread was thick and perfectly grilled and went really well with the three cheeses. Also, we ordered the blackened fish taco which contained flounder and a variety of spices. Really good. Topped with a three scoop vanilla and chocolate sundae. Good service found street parking around the corner. Check it out!!

5s_G-hB22z2JQqzD25Obng.text: The service was okay but our waitress kept forgetting everything we ordered. Which was one dessert for each of us (5). And one meal. The milkshake my sister got was the chocolate cookie dough and it tasted like powder mixed in. For example; miralax powder placed in a milkshake. It was just awful. My blueberry Cobbler was pretty good. The place was disguisting. They claim it's "old fashion" atmosphere. But no, it's just an excuse not to update anything. Its gross, old, and ruined furniture.

Mjtz_y6uVUUyiq0dZZsS0w.text: One of my favorites in Charlotte. The wait staff and manager are very friendly. Love the wide variety of the menu. The breakfast brunch is outstanding. Highly recommended.

Vj9b_WeUHsyBbZWEb_mjyg.text: Desserts are hit or miss, food is normal diner fare that's affordable, but the atmosphere is cool!  I'd bring a friend to impress with the throwback concept as you don't see these Old Fashioned soda shops anymore.  I'd recommend the pumpkin dessert that is not on the regular menu and shows up in the seasonal homemade desserts menu.  The brownie in the sundae is more cake-y than fudge-y if you prefer that.  Of course, you can't mess up their shakes and floats, which is why I would come back if I wanted to show around a visitor.

Huyuna8u8wbMUtG7ihV3Mg.text: We come here ofter for work lunches since we are right down the road.  Its hit or miss with service.  some days its phenomenal, other days Im tempted to walk in the back to get my own food.  lets be honest tho, I only come here to get the milkshake.  Cookies and cream is the best!

SoOolHrz33mfQsw5Mul6bA.text: OK- I know you are not supposed to judge a book by the cover and how many times have I been pleasantly surprised, but I wanted no part of Pike's, I really thought it was going to be average with no reason to think it, just my idea in my pea brain. So, I have lived here for nine years and never step foot into Pike's.   Today I decided to drop in, it was close to three, it is very cute, like an old fashion soda shop (that is a little revamped), a huge drug store clock where it's always ten till eight and cute little memorabilia around.   You may be asking, well Tonya, why the five stars? Let's start.  First of all my french fry barometer scored it a 'yahoooooo' for my scorched fingertips from the hot fries. I ordered a hot dog with raw onion, jalapeno and yellow mustard. My hot dog was made with love, the condiments went to both ends of the dog, not just in the middle and what really made me happy, the simple act of sprinkling salt and pepper on my fries before serving. I can tell, whoever was in the kitchen, prepared my lunch with love.   I also saw a Coca-Cola float go out with Mexican bottled Coke. Can I get a hell yeah? Sorry I was so harsh and judgmental.

Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States

Uvxu_LWTRMBZjucmhwnknQ.text: We went to this restaurant for a quick bite the day we moved to Charlotte, and we really liked it.  We enjoyed the food, and service was awesome.  Later it was the first patio we took our puppy to when we got him,  (perk- they are dog friendly).  The staff was really sweet and brought out a dog bowl of water for him,  and we were excited to find a place that we could take him.  But our most recent experience there has soured me from ever wanting to return.  My husband and I ordered take out lunch, and it was inedible. The salads were overdressed to the point that the lettuce was wilted and soggy, and my tuna steak which was supposed to be medium rare was well done and burned.  We ended up throwing our lunch away it was so bad.  I could forgive one bad food experience, especially since we have great memories at this restaurant (heck, everyone has an off day), but it was the customer experience after that has been a nightmare.  When we called to speak with a manager, we were given the option of a refund or a gift card.  We requested a refund, and were promised it would be done within a day or two (this was the day we ordered food).  After multiple calls (over a month and a half), and conversations with managers, (Nick and Chris), still no refund. Each conversation they were as sweet and apologetic as could be, promising immediate action, but then, no follow through.  They took our full card info down multiple times, each time claiming they didn't have it.  Last we spoke with a manager, they were going into the office to take care of it and would "call right back".  Surprise, surprise, no call back.  And when I called later that day to follow up with the manager, who was supposed to call me back, I was told he was "in a meeting".    The food is inconsistent, (but good when they are on), but the place is run poorly.  I may be sweet but I am not stupid.  If you aren't going to refund me for a poor product, then don't lie to me and say you are.  It's just rude.

Y5roUfgrwuDM5I2cZ9Dqcw.text: Was just told by the manager that "walk-ins" were a higher priority over our reservation for 12 that was called in well in advance and then confirmed the night before.  We went to Big Ben's across the street. They served us immediately.    Going to Pike's to celebrate birthdays was my suggestion. A mistake I won't make again.

GhDfbV1QLYtImWzMMU_u7w.text: My colleagues and I went to Pikes for lunch on a Friday. We had a 15 minute wait then ended up sitting outside. Now, I will say the service wasn't the best, however, their food made up for it tenfold.  I enjoyed the pecan chicken which was absolutely amazing, paired with an oreo milkshake (equally delicious). Also, their broccoli casserole was crispy and warm to the bite. Their mashed potatoes were a bit bland so if you do order it, I recommend swapping out the taters for something else like their delicious sweet potatoe casserole.   Overall I had a good experience. Service was a 3/5, but the food was a 5 which is why I'd recommend Pikes a solid 4 stars.

LoIxnG62VXySmGY5xx2hwA.text: First time going to Pikes. Had an amazing visit. My friend and I got there top seller. The honey pecan fried chicken. Their sweet potato and broccoli casserole is delicious. Tasted like a home cooked meal. Our food came fast and our waitress was very attentive. Will definitely be visiting again!

PusMQ2jNIE3ed8BRNkafqw.text: What a cute little lunch spot, been here a few times and great place to sit outside and eat with your dog.  Basic menu with some great bites, haven't tried the soda yet - as surprising as that is, but hope to do that down the road soon.

YtZ-Dsr8XFremF0FdiJUnA.text: Was visiting the area for the weekend and the friend we were staying with brought us here for the Sunday brunch. We came right before the big rush thankfully and were seated right away. Then we began to help ourselves immediately to the buffet.   It wasn't life altering or anything but it was pretty good. I wish there was more of a variety but i enjoyed everything I tasted and we were able to take some to go, which is always nice.   We sat outside and I only went inside long enough to  grab a plate and fill it, so I can't speak much on the atmosphere or decor. The staff was friendly and the Sunday brunch food was alright.  Can't speak on anything else though.

9PeYyD_c_nFigMG-ZDSNyw.text: So much fun to try out this old fashioned soda fountain. I consider myself quite the foodie and today I got to try my first phosphate (a cherry Pepsi) and my first Egg Cream Soda (a chocolate one). Be adventurous and try them, if you have not before.  But now, let's get really serious...Toll House Pie! Sighhh...

WvIXKKsZY9p2c1H2jaUhOQ.text: Pike's always seemed from the outside to be a place to grab a couple of shakes and talk about old pastimes. When we actually decided to sit down to give this place a try we were pleasantly surprised by the wide array of lunch and dinner food Pike's offered. My girlfriend and I were warmly greeted by the waiter, who had nothing but awesome recommendations for the desserts we were craving. After he recommended the blueberry cobbler because it was to die for we went ahead and ordered it.  Not only was the service quick, but the cobbler was AMAZING! Our waiter was super awesome because he gave us a free scoop of ice cream with the dessert (automatic return just for the service).   The ambiance of this place was just as old-fashioned as its name. We kept ourselves busy by exploring the glass cases full of old pharmaceutical products from the early 1900's along with old phones and signs.   We will be updating the review once we eat a delicious meal here in the near future.

2UmqfdzeFLrNo04pQe8R2g.text: Alright so I didn't really get the full effect of this place... I don't think. I just got a chocolate mint shake to go (I was at the outdoor movie in south end... Yea Man!). The shake was aight. Service was aight, considering I stood at the counter for at least a minute before someone acknowledged me. I mean, I couldn't get a, "Hi, be with you in one minute." Some people wouldn't care about the acknowledgement, but honestly it's the details, the little things like acknowledgment, and at least one check up that's factored in a good review.... I digress...  Bottom line: Baskin Robbins is better. I'll give them another shot and check out the food.

qT0H_ugzpKzD8cBld5H0Ow.text: I have always wanted to like this place, but the food is just terrible.  The ice cream is decent, but not anything special.  The atmosphere is great and I keep coming back hoping that it will improve.  I have tried it enough now to say that there isn't a reason to go back.  It's a shame, great location.

KhgZwymz6pm8AGizy2ivLw.text: I want to love this place but every time I have gone in for a meal or ice cream it has been incredibly dirty and the inside looks like it needs a good scrub. The staff is not very friendly and it took me 10+ minutes just to get a few milkshakes done. I waited next to a bar with about 4 place settings that had not been cleaned...to which they kept saying that they just left and were about to clean it. It seemed to me that they had left quite a while before I was there, and right before I ordered the waitress was mopping the floor and then proceeded to make the milkshakes without washing her hands. Needless to say we could not enjoy them.  I always see the patio seating packed - the only thing I can think is that people aren't going inside. I won't be going back!

r5cOpCcJzxHY3Ns8_MwOdA.text: During my most recent business trip, my client suggested meeting here for lunch.  The first thing I noticed was the outdoor seating which would be nice in the fall or spring.  We were seated near the back of the restaurant right at noon and even though it was crowded, I could still hear my client and have a conversation.    Our waitress was super sweet and honest with her food recommendations which I always appreciate.  I ended up splurging and going with the pecan fried chicken breast, the broccoli casserole, and the sweet potato casserole and was not disappointed.  My client and I both loved the pecan chicken and our sides.  I didn't want to over stuff myself at lunch but I could have literally cleaned my plate then had an extra serving of that broccoli casserole it was THAT good.  Unique and home cooked comfort food at its best.  I can't comment on the brunch but for lunch I am impressed.

oUZwl57D-yJFeOv_hYi5Eg.text: Much has been written about "Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop" in local print and web publication so we, as a family, decided to give it a try over Father's Day weekend.  Now let me personally review "Pike's Soda Shop" for you...  Most of the people writing that this place is "an authentic soda shop" or "retro" haven't lived through the 1940's or 50's to know what a REAL soda shop looks like; that is: Checkered marble floors, plush pink and turquoise booths and chrome interiors.  Pikes is none of that...It's a brick building, and once inside it feels no different than a modern sports bar.  So in that regard, haven driven thirty minutes to get there, we were disappointed.    Concerning the food, I ordered what was labeled "Meatloaf" on the menu and ended up getting something that was nothing more than a glorified salisbury steak with brown gravy poured all over the top.  I added a side of Mac and Cheese and didn't care for that either, as there were breadcrumbs baked in.  My father ordered a club sandwich less bread, and they brought him a bed of lettuce with Kraft singles cheese slices torn the length of the salad.  You of thought they'd just prepared the club sandwich the same way they normally would and used sandwich picks to hold the meal into place.  He said the lettuce was dry and the meal was "just fair."  When dinner was over I handed my credit card over to the waitress, and she then told me that their internet was down and that I'd have to wait awhile for them to ring me up; a couple of other families found themselves in the same predicament, and none of us could cash out.  While we were waiting the manager came over and asked if he could clear some of the plates out of our way, I said sure, and then I asked him what was going on with their internet that we wanted to settle up and leave.  He looks at me right in the face two feet away and says, "What are you talking about?"  I said we've been trying to settle up and can't because you can't process cards.  This MOMO just kept staring at me until we got up and I told him to fuck the hell off.  What a dumbass...Anyways after twenty additional minutes, we finally were able to settle up and leave.  The service, as far as drink refills and delivering meals, was at the 5 to 10% tip level and no more.  (1 out of 5 Stars)

FcFTTscsypXDiUjB4h_P2w.text: I went during Sunday brunch and got the buffet. They had a good selection of food such as: pastries, bacon, grits, biscuits, gravy, quiche, pies, French toast, lasagna, eggs. The food was... good, not over-the-top fantastic, I rarely season my food once it's prepared, but there were a couple of items that needed extra attention (i.e. grits).  The service was absolutely excellent! Chris was super busy with quite a few tables but he was very attentive and a rockstar with, not only our table, but the others around us too. I really appreciated that.   I would go back again to try lunch/dinner.

ndTZX51RBXlynOLybUXKrA.text: Pikes has always been there for me for as long as I can remember.  It's a great place to grab lunch and/or a milkshake.  I love Pike's SouthEnd location - and now with the light rail, it is really accessible from the East/West Lynx Station.  Parking can sometimes be tough... there are parallel spots out front on Camden and some lots in the back, but usually it works out.  The decor and atmosphere is great - Some of the items on the walls make it really cozy.  The old school pharmacy clock really is a great piece - makes you think about how soda shops were, way back when.  Nothing really flashy or fancy here... just good old fashioned food.  I love their sandwiches and burgers.  And for those of you who have bigger appetites, there are entree sized stuff just for you.  Where else can you get Thanksgiving Dinner Roast Turkey and stuffing on a regular basis?

B7TqgpmaYDaPvKqRfWuXkg.text: I came in for the first time this past weekend and left highly disappointed. Things started off good ( hence one star), but ended on a sour note. We were seated right away upon entering and proceeded to order. About 15 minutes later our waitress advised us that our food would be ready in about 2-4 minutes. 10 minutes later she returned and told us that our food was sent to another table and that our order would have to be redone. At this point I was appreciative that we were informed about the situation and that it was being taken care of. 30 minutes later our order came (which I think was almost given away to another table again). We immediately dug into our food because at this point we were hungry not realizing that my son's burger was not the burger that he ordered. He decided to eat it anyways because he was that hungry and didn't want to wait for it to be redone a second time. The waitress apologized for the mix up and offered us a couple of free scoops of ice cream for our inconvenience. I had already planned to order the fudge sundae before this happened so I requested for that to be our free ice cream instead. She informed us that she was not sure she could do that but she would check. Needless to say, we did get the fudge sundae however it was included in my bill and the waitress gave me $2 for my troubles. I am not sure who runs this place or who told her to do that, but that was TACKY. I ended up not taking the $2 and leaving it there for her tip, which would have been WAY more then that had this been handled the right way. I didn't even ask for a discount on my bill just for the free ice cream that was already offered to be a sundae instead of two measly scoops... I will not be returning and will not be recommending to anyone else. I get better service at Culver's and Cowfish, I will be sticking to those establishments instead.

lSPTad1n1guPogSJgumD5A.text: Stopped in to use the facilities on a walk about and walked out with toll house pie and peach cobbler. Once home, I discovered they did not put the ice cream in the bag, which I watched them scoop into a styrofoam cup. The toll house pie was good, but the cobbler was far from what I would describe as cobbler. It was pie. Oh well. It was something sweet and I didn't have to make it.

_bq9BOr7Gb__2nDqw3ggtQ.text: This place is super cute and nostalgic. It is in a great location right off the rail trail if you're looking for an old fashioned diner. They have everything you would expect from a breakfast buffet to milkshakes. The ice cream sundaes are amazing and the staff is incredibly nice!

Yckmqrk0qSu5pyzHM5X3aA.text: Ate there for the first time last night. Came down with food poisoning. Shame really because the place is chill and has a nice varied menu. I ordered the club with fries and a neapolitan shake. I had not had a meal all day other than a bowl of cereal for breakfast so it had to be something in the club I'm guessing, maybe some old ham, who knows. Oh well...

KLq5oce1Cm95hO3ofETAug.text: We came here a few days ago with some family. We had heard this place was good so we figured we would try it out.   2 aspects I am reviewing:  Food and service.  Food: 5 stars.  Service: 1 star. Average of 3.   First the Food. I ordered the burger with homemade chips (apparently they don't have fries on the weekends?) The homemade chips were crispy and delicious. The burger had great flavor and was cooked to the correct temp (just pink but not red). My husband ordered the breakfast buffet and it was all very good. I tried his Cesar salad and broccoli casserole. I think that the broccoli casserole was the best I've had. It had great flavor and a crunchy top. The buffet is definitely a good option if you are hungry. They have breakfast and lunch options, so many choices available. The milkshakes are also quite tasty. I tried the Oreo milkshake and it was rich and creamy!   Now to the Service: We were seated fairly quickly, so that was good. When the server came to take our order, we asked what was good. She just said the burger. Ok, sounds good we'll order that. The table ordered 3 burgers, 1 buffet and a couple milkshakes. Not a tough order. The burgers did have different toppings requested... (i.e. one wanted lettuce and tomato, another wanted onions and bacon, and the third wanted all the toppings). There was a bit of confusion about the milkshake order. There was discussion about whether they would be ordered at the same time and come out with the meal or later after the meal. It was decided that the milkshakes would come out later.  My husband asked the server about the local beers. She simply said she didn't drink beer so she didn't know. Ok, I do understand that, but it would have been nice for her to say I don't know, but I can get Joe Shmoe who drinks all the time to tell you about them. My husband said he would look them up and pick one. She never came back to get his beer order.  When the burgers came out, they were all messed up. It was as if she had taken the order then scrambled it to see how many things she could mix up. Mine which was only supposed to have lettuce and tomato came out with mayonnaise, mustard, ketchup, tomato and onion... someone else's who was supposed to have bacon and onions came out with lettuce, bacon, ketchup and mustard and the third was just a hodge podge of randomness. The server already seemed annoyed so I just scraped off my mayonnaise (ugh) and told her it was fine. One of the others in our group sent his back because it was so wrong.   There were only about 8 chips on the plate. It was a tiny amount... it was as if they ran out of chips and just decided to give everyone a couple chips to make them happy.   Finally, during the meal, someone asked if the milkshakes had been made because they wanted to adjust their order. A normal server would have said, no they haven't what would you like. She responded with "no! because you told me not to make them until the end! Right?!" she was extremely agitated that they were asking about the milkshakes. She never came and checked in on us to make sure everything was good...   All in all it was a quite unpleasant experience.

8epESBZ4QVO8FfZz4ySzEQ.text: Food is down right bland. And as i was sitting on the side where kitchen doors are there were roaches scrambiling on the floor. Eeeeeeew. Food was tasteless and the owner talks to his staff like slaves.

eAxiWVbwVSETmiSKKoRDMA.text: Easy access to some down-home cooking in the South End.  This is Southern cooking and Southern hospitality as it's meant to be seen.  The menu is filled with enough to please any palette in the group.  The service is warm and inviting and the parking is...well...hope you find close parking...but the walk shouldn't be too bad if you don't.  Pike's is nice.  It's a good place to grab some lunch.

KkwJc89FW39pd796vCBQFw.text: Atmosphere: The building is nestled perfectly with a decent amount of parking on two streets. They offer outdoor seating with area heaters if the weather is cold. As you walk in their is a bar with group seating on either sides of the restaurant. The decor takes you back in time and is almost perfect, save the full wooden tables. The music comes straight out of the decade.  Service: I sat down at a partially dirty table and my waiter came a speedy two minutes later to take my drink order. When he came back and took my food order he tried to change my burger to a custom one that would have had me pay more for the same ingredients. However, he realized his error after starting to write down what I wanted on it. He came back multiple times to check on me and I didn't have to wait long to get my check and pay.  Food: I had a Classic American Burger with fries. To drink I had a hand-made cherry phosphate and vanilla milkshake. My burger was juicy and moist. The pickles were thick and the lettuce was crisp and fresh. The fries tasted frozen but were still nicely cooked and seasoned. My cherry phosphate was not light or heavy leaving me very refreshed. The vanilla milkshake was amazing. I would probably say in my top 5 of any I've had.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Classic burger and cherry phosphate.
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. View from my side table.

sT6uPB6HAA7N46SeXy5UZw.text: This edition of Exited about Eating features a bonus since we visited two restaurants on a holiday weekend. Our first visit was to the South End of Charlotte to Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop.   Now when I hear Soda Shop, it brings back memories of diners that were located in drug stores forty years ago and this place meets the billing. We visited on a Sunday and they were serving their Brunch buffet which I was eager to try. Service was attentive and friendly, and brunch provided a wide variety of both breakfast and lunch selections and also quite of few sweet options.  For breakfast, the standout item for me was the biscuits with sausage gravy. The biscuits were light and fluffy and the gravy creamy with just the right amount of sausage. For lunch, the broccoli casserole stood out, tender, rich, and packed with broccoli. Also the scones and key lime pie were outstanding choices.   Dora here. Lots of carb heavy dishes, but not enough proteins for me. Some of my faves: blueberry french toast, coffee cake, and carrot cake. See what I mean? :) Flavor was great, but a tad lukewarm for my taste. I'm the gal who orders my coffee extra hot.   I would rate this establishment 4 forks out of 5 for a family friendly restaurant serving great food.  Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunch buffet
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunch buffet

Ai1RbX-AfNNjCDPLcVnEKA.text: If you are looking for home cooked food in a laid back atmosphere, Pike's is where it's at! Don't let the name fool you, they have a much wider variety on their menu than any other soda shop I've ever been! I'm addicted to one of the house favorites: Honey Pecan Fried Chicken with two sides of your choice. I get broccoli and cheese casserole and fried okra! (I would have a picture if I hadn't inhaled it so quickly. I remembered I was supposed to be Yelping as I ate my last bite of broccoli and cheese cass, oops). My pops had the fried flounder special and get this.......it was bottomless!!! Bomb.com! Oh and if you're into the whole veggie plate thing, my mom got one of those and loved it. Me, I'm a meat eater! You're welcome.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey pecan fried chicken with broccoli and cheese cass and fried okra! Slap yo mama! You&#39;re welcome.

WZr0PWnuRu6Xe1Q3CqkSCQ.text: Pike's is a charming, retro styled diner in Southend.  The only daunting thing about this establishment is the parking.  If you can parallel park on the street, you are good to go. My man and I ordered the vegetable plate.  You could chose 4 vegetables, or three and a salad.  We chose the salad with blue cheese dressing.  A very generous portion arrived, with fresh, crisp vegetables.  The dressing was a bit thin, and I would have enjoyed chunks of blue cheese. My veggie plate featured the mashed potatoes, fried okra, and broccoli casserole.  Oh my goodness!  Such incredible flavors that caused me to eat it all although I probably  should have stopped.  My husband ordered the same, except he substituted Mac and cheese for the potatoes. Our server was the sweetest thing and embodied real, genuine soda shop service. So, daunting parking aside, I am coming back.

Uu1MW1idqTm-btCN1MGotQ.text: I wasn't impressed. The ice cream was good but they were stingy with the hot fudge which is the best part of the whole Sundae experience.  Not impressed with the flavors either- only about 8.

5MECKCuHIEYNAmJdye_5Qg.text: I was really excited to try this Charlotte staple. I've lived in Charlotte for so many years and I always overlook this little spot. After my office had some food catered from Pikes, it stuck in my head to give it an in person try. On Sunday craving brunch with little diner type spots to choose from, I decided on Pikes. With a a price tag of 14.00 for brunch, I was expecting to be blown away. Blown away I was not. Around noon we were seated right away however, our waitress seemed less than thrilled to be working. she wasn't rude, but not attentive and you could just tell she didn't want to be there. Hey, maybe it was an off day.  On to the food... despite what the sign in our booth said, Mac and Cheese isn't served on Sunday ( disappointment) My sister ordered a bare bones cheese burger and it was just okay. Thrown on the plate with some chips- not very appetizing especially for a place that calls themselves a soda shop...? really, that's how you present a burger?  On to the brunch, there was lot to choose from, but everything was just fine. The biscuits were cold, the scrambled eggs were bland and the potato casserole was drowning in cheese that you couldn't taste potato. The eggs benedict did look good,but I didn't try that. We sampled some of the desserts and those didn't disappoint. Next time I'm looking to drop 15-20 bucks on brunch, I would much rather go to Terrace Cafe or Toast. Pikes, I wanted to love you so so much, but I left very disappointed. *** with all that said, I will go back one more time and order off the lunch/ dinner menu, maybe that will change my opinion.

rtTB9tFZ8CaL-1Lelaebvg.text: The decor at pikes is really fun but the food isn't great. I had the Hawaiian chicken sandwich and it's pretty much just chicken breast with a slice of pineapple, ok but nothing special. Their milkshakes and house made chips are pretty good however.

photos.caption: Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside pikes
Photo of Pike's Old Fashioned Soda Shop - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brownie ice cream Sunday

nUEUj5Er_9M4csQO_sP9gA.text: We had a cup of chili to start then the Carolina burger and grilled cheese. Carolina burger was cooked to my order of medium and as messy as it should have been. Could only eat half because it was so filling.   Cute diner atmosphere and smiling staff!

Peps40pI0sAx9JGNsc6sjA.text: We took out of town visitors here for lunch and everyone enjoyed their meals.  Buffalo Chicken Sandwich-Spicy fried perfect and great portion size Chicken Pot Pie-Flakey well prepared Chocolate Milkshake-Thick and enough for three glasses Blueberry Cobbler -Nice thick crest and very fresh blueberries  Fish Tacos-Well seasoned and perfect portion size

fAqNfA2oXxHbkSLhKjcoLw.text: This is my favorite breakfast/brunch place in Charlotte. You can order off the menu or they have a buffet which included grits, biscuits, eggs, pastries, roast, mac and cheese, green beans, lasagna and usually three different desserts. Get there early because a table can be hard to come by.

TVp5qgtMsGXNL2WIks2C0Q.text: This is your typical trendy spot that everyone swarms to with bad food, poor service and inferior overall presence. Be prepared to wait up to an hour to be seated for weekend brunch. Once you do get seated and you dig into the space food options, you'll kick yourself for wasting your time.

Fco2xeTwONJtQEHArrKBOA.text: Great place to go for brunch, especially on Sunday for the buffet, although it can get pretty crowded during this time and for normal lunch rush.   The milkshakes are great. I would go here just for some chocolatey frozen goodness, although the rest of the menu is pretty tasty as well.  I also like the lasagna and the burgers, and did I already mention the milkshakes? Ymmm.  4 stars from me.

vhsaybcQCb-mnt2IigcRmA.text: I went to Pike's last weekend for brunch after a wild night out and left a happy man. Still hungover, but all filled up.   As far as I can tell, Pike's is famous for its weekend buffet, which is like $14 (sounds like a lot, but it's as much as you can eat, and it's alll good). This gets you access to normal breakfast stuff (scrambled eggs, potatoes etc) BUT also southern treats like biscuits and gravy and grits (which are definitely worth trying). If you get there a little late and are feeling like lunch, there are options like meatloaf and various other meat cuts for your pleasure. Just don't go there looking for a light meal.   The best best part if the dessert. I know, dessert after breakfast feels a little weird, but don't deny yourself--great coffee cakes, cupcakes, and carrot cake. I repeat: i left stuff. and happy.

Bxi5Fhsk9StKy6C5Rqk6GA.text: Went for Sunday brunch. Ordered a Western Omelet - it was ok. Others at my table got the all-you-can-eat buffet, and seemed to enjoy it - I think this is a quantity over quality kind of place. One highlight was the hashbrown casserole - very tasty!

fD9TS0yLyu0mZbHHJ8Nq1g.text: This was a toss up- I could have just as easily gone 4 stars. The milkshakes and desserts are great, however the food was just okay (yes I tried the honey pecan chicken).   It is worth checking out and I would certainly recommend stopping by for a sundae after dinner someplace else.

SKtZM9w9jQLZMnPUGLuTNQ.text: I gave pike's another few trys. I am now in love with the BLTS! they are really good. They also have great mac n cheese and French fries. I knew the place was great, just had to order the right thing for me!  I have still not tried the milkshakes, maybe next time.

H4WBQDQiLlQCoDj-SEvYHA.text: Wow! This was a great find.  Great food and friendly staff.  Clean and great atmoshere.  This is a not Fine Dining but a great place to eat. Will defiantely go out of my way to eat here again.

4aloWX8ByWptMW0YOpkySQ.text: Have been to Pike's many times for Brunch (it's great value), but recently went there for lunch during the week.  Ordered a salad which was decent, but not outstanding.  My fault for not selecting a better menu option.  My two compadres ordered the BLT and both thought it was delicious.  Service a tad on the slow side.  Also had to wait about 10 minutes to get a table.  I'll go back for lunch and definitely for brunch.

qRIYrRK-tQIybL4YK_nhig.text: Fantastic food, service and overall a wonderful experience. I love how progressive south end is becoming! It's so simple to get too and right off the light rail.

vzq0D_mMrObS0sy89DW6bw.text: I accidentally happened upon this place after hitting a furniture store in the area.  Felt lucky because I had the best milkshake I have ever eaten...  it was peanut butter banana!  And they give you a huge portion of it (fills up your glass twice).  And then I had the cobb salad which was good, too, and was VERY large!  Probably one of the largest salads I have ever seen.  And from the sounds of it, the desserts are supposed to be delicious.  Would definitely like to go back again and try one of those.  And I like the old school, soda shop vibe.  Definitely a cute atmosphere.

2jZxjX2daXLEO6lizhFCGA.text: Just came here for a Mother's Day brunch.  We called the day before and made reservations for 11:00 knowing that it was going to busy.  We arrived about 5mins early and were told that the the table was just going to be cleaned up and we would be seated.  We proceeded to wait for half an hour.  We saw people get seated that had just put their names on the list while we waited, and these were parties of the same size as us (7).  Once we were finally seated we all decided to get the buffet which was kind of the special.  Once up at the buffet it got worse.  It seemed like they had been way overwhelmed. There were things on the buffet that were missing  like the prime rib, there was just a pile of the fat scraps and no one there cutting anything.  There were things that were cold and picked over as well.  Also none of the plates or cups matched, which is not really a big deal but just added to the unprofessional appearance.  I used to like going to this place when I lived here and thought it would be a good spot to take my mom.  It turned out horrible and I will never be returning here, nor recommending it to anyone.

LsVn-4Bf1B6CtwLKKf_Pjg.text: The food here is great - my problem with the place is around two things:  ok although a minor problem it still is a consistent problem...every time I go I get a milkshake and every time it is not mixed well enough.  This results in huge chunks of ice cream you have to mash or wait for it to melt.  I dont like that.  The second problem I have with this place is the service.  I have gone four times at varying times of the day and always the service is subpar.  I end of flagging down the waiter for refills and begging for the check again and again.  But the food is good so if you are only interested in the food and the cute atmosphere then this is your place...not for me though.

ItnYtfU6QhBPIIoXFkMrow.text: Very cute place. Reasonably priced. I went there for Sunday brunch with two friends. Place was pretty crowded but was not too noisy at all. Server is very friendly. I LOVE the tomato basil soup there. Usually Im not big fan of this soup. But PIKE totally changed my mind. I will come back soon~~~

MopUGmcjVY0sUbvMdWU3hg.text: Love this for brunch.  Took a friend visiting from Nashville when it was truly brunch with both the lunch & breakfast items.  My cupcake was moist & frosting delicious.  Hers had been sitting a bit longer - the cake was dry.  The eggs benedict, french toast, carving station, & dessert bars certainly live up to what I would expect in a brunch.  We were seated quickly & the watier was very attentive.  Liked it so much took my boyfriend who has lived in Charlotte for 12  yrs & didn't know it existed.  We went before the lunch items came out.  Still fantastic but definitely recommend 10AM or after when the lunch, carving, & dessert stations are available giving the full brunch experience.

jYSXY8oatSMw2T6oIXUlKg.text: The place itself the decor was old fashion wasnt an issue. When it comes to the servers they are fat with big gut bellies that hang over with filthy food stain shirts. They are gross! Food was tastelss. I wont be going back dont by the hype who cares if shallow hal was filmed there.

gajjULb_AvxhsUY13zzQwA.text: We had the Sunday Breakfast/Brunch Buffet.  Very good!  Great coffee and service.  Kinda expensive for breakfast but considering the quality and variety, it was worth it.  Can't wait go eat there again, when its warmer, outside on the patio.

F_NOgPo3NogSzJPPZXS_aA.text: Pike's was always the place we went to grab onion rings and a milkshake, and it's still a great place to go do that.  The problem with this Pike's location is that they have a full menu that they don't seem able to deliver.  The last time i went i was quickly served my milkshake, but I left after waiting 25 minutes for my food (the waitress never came by and there was no one else eating at the restaurant).  The last time my parents went they said the food was ok, but that when they were brought their food originally both of their meals were wrong.

vQiaU3mbRFi94eP3MfZ2kw.text: I really enjoyed the old pharmacy feel of the place with the decoration.  I just like anything with an old timey theme to it.  If you can avoid the lunch rush do so, it can get kind of crazy at times.  But other than that it's a nice little place.  The chicken salad is great and the selection of ice cream and shakes can provide endless fun.
